40949483.review:
I am writing this game after 3 hours in, I will potentially update it later. Be aware that I have no practical experience with games in this genre before playing, the closest things being Super Mario Smash Brothers and Pirates of the Caribbean 3 on the PS2. 

By far this game's strongpoint is the music, animation, characters, and how they all interact. Much of the game seems to be designed around this art, though that is by no means to indicate that the mechanics are in any way weak as far as I can tell. 

This game is very easy to pick up. Currently at 3 hours in, I have a 90% win rate between Story and Dark Lords battles, with some of those hours being spent in "Dojo." It seems, however, that various mechanics would make it difficult against human players, such as grabs ignoring blocks, each block countering attacks from 2 directions, and a "combo breaker" mechanic making prediction > button mashing. 

Regarding the music, animation, and characters, that is easy enough to check into on YouTube and I *highly* recommend looking into the trailers, gameplay footage, and ost before deciding whether to buy this game. I have linked a few of my favorite music tracks below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7wHVXaQRuFU
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ckR822Wu4k

There isn't a lot to say on art, characters, and music that a gameplay video can't get across. Mechanically, it is very easy to pick up due to autocombos, but battles don't get stale in the way that the PotC3 PS2 game did where spamming counterattacks was the only worthwhile move to get damage in. Battles remain dynamic and engaging, requiring intelligent offense and defense. Afaict.

40728408.review:
This is the best fighting game that didn't blow up because it was locked away behind being an exclusive.

This is the best fighting game you haven't played.

Double Helix and Iron Galaxy created something fucking amazing here. So many good things can be said about this game. The cast of characters is diverse and unique in both theme and gameplay style. The fighting system core is incredibly deep. The Steam version is a complete and full package. There is an insanely high skill ceiling. There are a plethora of modes to play. There are developers that care. There's a deep history. There's great graphics. It has probably the best soundtrack of any fighting game even if the master lacks a little bit of dynamism or vibrance. There's not one but two mega badass Native American dudes. There are twin sisters and one of them is a vampire. There is a cyber raptor.

I've seen reviews say that the online is dead and this is complete bullshit. The game is crossplay compatible with the xbox and lots of xboners play. It's only ranked that is more sparsely populated because ranked was limited to Steam.

After playing for a while I have to say that the thing that impresses me the most is just the sheer depth of the fighting system. There are so many disparate elements all connected. Openers vs. Linkers to start a combo and how they interact with the new combo guage, one doing more damage and allowing stronger combo enders and the other being quicker and eating more guage; auto-doubles vs. manuals; different types of enders that either build meter, create juggle opportunities, cause wall bounce, or do damage; the relationship between combo breaks, counter combo breaks, shadow breaks, and the psychology that forms around them; the various differences between the highly different characters and their various command attacks. All of it adds up to a fighting system with a mountain of depth.

But it's not like Street Fighter. Somene that plays SF can play KOF and recognize the familiarity. They can play Arc stuff and while it's different, it's still in the same ballpark. Then you have KI and it's just completely in a world of its own. This hurts it because in order to really start to enjoy this game you need to have at least dozens of hours or some amount like that, of time in it. Most don't get that far. The AI is not the strongest or at least most fun part of this game and the story mode is a bit weak by Netherealm's lofty standards; though it also has a turn-based campaign mode like Marvel vs. Capcom 3's Heroes and Heralds (and yes there are microtransactions, but they are completely ignorable and you can get everything through play and also the game hands you premium currency over time). So when these Steam people play online, what happens?

They get spanked.

They fucking get spanked by xboners that have been playing for years, that have gone deep into a fighting game system that can have you go real deep. Oh man they get spanked.

On the other hand, if you play past that, you will start to understand how deep and creative and awesome the fighting game system is. It's not perfect, but it's one of the best around right now. It's so fun to join a lobby and just watch two level 50 xboners that have been playing for years just fucking go against eachother in this pscyhological war. You see the culture that has accumulated over time as this guy will hold a grab for the full duration as a taunt or that guy will end his ultra early out of respect. It's so fun to watch.

So I'll say again this is the best fighting game you've never played.

Honestly, I consider it a mark against EVO's credibility that EVO doesn't include this.

If you're "casual" (whatever that is supposed to mean), you may not like the spankings, or the learning curve (this game pioneered the good tutorial mode modern fighting games are expected to have). If you played SF style games, you may not like how different it is, or that you're getting spanked.  If you don't play fighting games, you may not like any of it, least of all the spankings.

There are a few downsides. The Steam release has at times been buggy, but it's still being patched and supported as of this review. Ranked doesn't have a ton of activity (which is kind of a shame because you wouldn't get spanked there). Some say there are some problems with support of older controllers or more obscure peripherals (that's kind of a bad one).

But this is the other western fighting game. This is a fantastic iteration of it. The poor xboners can't go to EVO. The Steam version is painfully under-appreciated.

Mega props to what IG and DH built.

40617071.review:
[h1] Killer instinct vulgo melhor jogo de luta[/h1]

 Killer instinct de 2013 foi lançado pro Xone e chegou tardiamente ao PC, mas isso não tira em nenhum momento o seu mérito, mas o que difere Killer instinct de SF? KoF?

COMBOS, COMBOS, COMBOS E MAIS COMBOS, em Street fighter um combo pode ser considerado bom se tiver uns 5/6/7 hits, aqui em KI o negócio é bem mais embaixo, começando de 4 a 70 hits, sim 70 HITS, KI é um jogo de luta que extrapola testosterona, seja pela sua gama de personagens, seja pelos cenários, seja pelo narrador berrando no jogo, o que deixa a adrenalina a mil, você ta entendendo o que eu to querendo te passar meu amigo? a partir de agora leia a analise ouvindo isso aqui por favor https://youtu.be/JAb5SasJ2Y4?t=49

 O jogo é um fight game 2D focado em combos, e sendo bem diferente dos outros por 3 motivos, os combos exageradamente insanos e a barra de vida, sim a barra de vida aqui funciona diferente, se você ganha do seu oponente o primeiro round, mas perdeu 75% da vida, azar, ela vai continuar do jeito que tá, isso torna o jogo extremamente competitivo e forçando o jogador a pensar bem antes de fazer uma investida, e o fator principal que deixa a luta mais insana é o dublador literalmente BERRANDO enquanto a porrada ta comendo, escute ele berrando aqui, e recomendo que coloque a uma altura satisfatoriamente alta para sentir a testosterona https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xQIUi9bqMvw e notem que se você ta recebendo uns 25 hits e da counter breaker, escute o berro do Mike, deixei o melhor do narrador pro final, quando a barra do oponente está em danger, você pode fazer ultra combo que já explicarei a seguir, mas quando você faz, Mike fala um ultra combo diferente que arrepia os cabelo do **, escute essa explosão de testosterona em volume alto e arrepie os cabelos https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6rKjZtyHsvI , chega de falar do melhor e vamos pro técnico!

[h1] JOGABILIDADE	[/h1]

Killer funciona de forma bem simples, 3 botões de soco sendo fraco, medio e forte
3 botões de chute sendo fraco, medio e forte

Se você joga com assistente de combos habilitado, é literalmente um button smashing, mas não adianta muito, se você começa a apanhar e acha que o oponente está batendo com o soco forte, aperta soco forte + chute forte para quebrar o combo e poder revidar, isso deixa o jogo literalmente insano pelo fato de que você inicia com um forte, passa pro fraco e fica até finalizar com um médio, quem ta apanhando precisa adivinhar qual está utilizando, questão de treino mesmo, em KI temos a barra de especial que se chama sombra, certos golpes ficam mais fortes e duram mais quando se usa 1 barra dessas ( máximo de 2 ), podendo aumentar ainda mais os combos, temos a barra de instinto que quanto mais apanha, mais ela enche, essa é diferente que quando ativada ( SF + CF ) o personagem fica em um estado alterado, sendo cada personagem diferente, por exemplo Jago recupera vida, Orchid ganha um leopador infinito durante esse tempo, isso também serve para aumentar mais ainda os combos desse jogo insano.


[h1] GRÁFICOS[/h1]

Estão extremamente bonitos, particulas de poderes voando, especiais, tudo nessa coisa é bonita, nem tem muito que falar

[h1] SONS[/h1]

Rock + sons de ossos quebrando + mike berrando = MELHOR JOGO

[h1] PERSONAGENS[/h1]

É aqui que killer instinct brilha meus amigos, é aqui que esse jogo mostra o que é ser foda, Street fighter tem o que? lutadores de países diferentes, pô legal, mortal kombat tem o que? Humanos de planos diferentes, e outras raças como tarkateanos, répteis e tal, pô divertido e bacana, e Killer instinct?

Guerreiro, Lobisomen, UM FUCKING DINOSSAURO, um Esqueleto guerreiro, um robo que deixa cyrax, smoke e sektor no chinelo, um fantasma oriental alá o grito, uma MÚMIA, um FODENDO GOLEM, um ET, uma amazona, um homem de fogo mais foda que tocha humana, uma robo que se recria, uma gárgula gigante e um ogro de 2 cabeças com um porrete pra te quebrar em 7 e 3 FODENDO PARTICIPAÇÕES ESPECIAIS, O FODENDO GENERAL RAAM DE GEARS OF WAR, SIM AQUELE MALDITO QUE QUASE TE FEZ QUEBRAR O CONTROLE COM AQUELAS BORBOLETAS PRETAS, O Árbitro de Halo 2 que é outro personagem daora e o FODENDO RASH DE BATTLETOADS, SIM AQUELES SAPOS DAQUELE JOGO INFERNAL LÁ, ELE TA AQUI E É O PERSONAGEM MAIS WTF DO JOGO, SÓ PIADA COM ELE

Esse é o repertório desse jogo que faz dele ser foda perto de outros

[h1] ENREDO[/h1]

Essa parte para mim ele fraqueja, o enredo envolve gargos dominar a terra e blá blá blá, mas o modo história real do jogo, você fica com 3 personagens para tentar vencer o gargos de dominar o planeta terra, é legal, mas não joguei muito, cada personagem tem seu modo história com 3 finais diferentes, que para liberar são tarefas in game, ultra combo em todos os personagens, ultra combo em personagem X, apenas finalizar


[h1] ULTRA COMBO[/h1]

 Essa é a mágica do jogo, quando a luta está para acabar com um dos lutadores fica em danger, apertando certos botões dentro de um combo, você manda um ultra combo que é uma finalização especial que o personagem vencedor fica batendo no que perdeu por X vezes, sim, a barra de vida ja sumiu e o perdedor continua perdendo, e o mais radical que quando ta ocorrendo o ultra, uma sinfonia musical começa a tocar conforme os golpes vão batendo com o cenário sendo destruido ao fundo, quem tiver paciencia pode ver nesse link https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W0uAdUN_gqw

[h1] DIFICULDADE[/h1]

 Fácil de jogar, dificil de mestrar, o jogo é legal para brincar com iniciantes que conseguem jogar, e o sistema de combo dele permite uma virada épica se der vacilo, a IA do jogo é desafiadora a partir do muito dificil a Killer, eu recomendo jogar no dificil que é o ideal

[h1] RESUMO DA ÓPERA	[/h1]

O jogo é excelente, e tem uma personalidade única quanto a outros jogos de luta, eu recomendo fortemente para qualquer fã do gênero fight games, e vai por mim se um dia jogar, tenta ligar num sistema de som que bote respeito e jogue num volume alto e trema na base com o mike berrando enquanto a porradaria rola solta.

40542519.review:
Un excelente port y una exelente idea traer este titulo de microsoft a la tienda de steam, lastima que no haya podido mantener jugadores en linea, la mayoria son de xbox los que encontraremos en las salas online y son los que quedaron mas pro no hay un publico casual ya.
Esta bien optimizado podremos jugarlo sin problema con 1 gb de targeta grafica incluso bajando la resolucion de 1920. Los graficos se ven igual o mejor que la version de xbox y en televisores se puede apreciar mejor los detalles.
Los modos de juego son el clasico campaña donde nos contaran la historia de cada personaje que esta en una dificultad facil por defecto pero podemos hacer los desafios ademas que nos plantean por personaje que nos dara algo mass de dificultad. La historia de cada personaje es breve y se amplia un poco en la temporada 2 pero para otros personajes, la verdad me ha gustado ambas temporadas pero realmente lo principal son las peleas no nos quedara tanto en el recuerdo como otros titulos la trama como en mortal kombat.
El otro modo importante es señores de la sombra donde tendremos que enfrentarnos a la invacion de Gargos en diferentes partes del mundo pero con los mismos escenarios del juego, tiene una historia a desbloquear pero hacia el final la dificultad sera elevada y nos costara terminarlo.
Hay otros modos como entrenamiento o un crear un reflejo que añadiran algunas mas horas.
Muy buen port lastima que no hay gente en steam, solo tendremos la ventaja del crossplay con gente de xbox pero los modos de un jugador vienen cargado de contenido y con todos los personajes que salieron.

Killer Instinct is definitely a game that requires that you learn how to play a character; it's not just button mashing; each character has unique mechanics and quirks that make them stand out in a game with nearly 30 players. 
I'd also suggest you check out the Killer Instinct wiki which has some instructions on how certain combos work out.

My only gripe is that playing with the keyboard can be a minor pain regarding combos; accidently ending a combo while pummeling the opponent is embarrassing.

Overall, I'd highly recommend this game for those who don't want to play SF or MK.

40305833.review:
I have a bit of a love hate relationship with this game. For starters, I grew up playing the older ones and most fondly remember the N64 versions most. The awesome music is by far the best part of KI because it feels like no matter what song you pick they are all pretty awesome in their own way. The steam version comes with all characters unlocked already. So you are paying for a full completed version of the game. Which I hear the older non steam versions were not the case. So that means this version is probably the best version to buy I assume.

The game does have an in game store, but to explain it. Everything in the store is gained in time anyways just for playing the characters or modes in the game. There is absolutely no need what so ever to spend a dime once you buy the game. You will unlock everything no matter what so long as you take the time to play the game. 

Now comes where my love and hate starts to kick in. The game itself is pretty darn good I feel, It really does a good job bringing back nostalgia and the way it fights is extremely fun to learn and fairly easy to master but can be quite a challenge depending on how good you are at fighters in general. I absolutely hated the fact that I could not alt-tab out during a loading screen to chat with friends on steam or suddenly my controller would stop working and I was forced to fight people with my keyboard. That was absolutely unacceptable to me. 

The next love hate thing has to do with ranked. While I understand why they did what they did here...I do not understand why they simply just didn't give us a  choice. Currently, You can only do competative matches against other players on steam. And..again, I understand why this was done. Its no fun for new players to come in and get completely demolished by people who have played the game fo years on Xbox. So I really feel the better method here was to give players the choice. But we do not have that. if you play ranked, you will play only from a pool of other players on steam..the result is the ranked playerbase will seem abysmal compared to what it could have been. 

And the lobby system is just a joke...really..its just bad compared to its competition. 

All in all...if you want to get this game. It is what seems to me to be the best and most up to date version of the game. If you are a KI fan its an absolute must unless you have aleady purchased elsewhere. But at this point in time don't expect a large audience in it. I paid for it and the soundtrack, and I still do not regret my decision. But I am also a total fangurl over KI since back in the arcades and N64. All that being said I think the game has some flaws that got overlooked and also some bad game design decisions. It could have been better, But it also could have been a metric ton worse. 

8/10 - The awesome soundtrack and really fun and involved gameplay keeps your attention for quite a while, and there are plenty of ways to learn and grow as a fighter here and have some serious fun or get totally demolished by those better than you.  But the flaws prevent me from being able to give this game the 10/10 I wish I could say it deserved from me.

40283707.review:
In meinen Augen
ein gelungenes Spiel

bietet recht gute Optik nicht Atemberaubend aber ordentlich.
Läuft auch unter win 8 da es bei release hieß Win 10 only war das Spiel lange Zeit für mich abgehakt.

Spielerisch recht abwechslungsreich bietet eine ganze Menge Möglichkeiten.
Charakterdesign und Animationen sind sehr gelungen
auch wenn die Kämpferauswahl sich teils wiederholt...
Es gibt viel Freischaltbares
Die Story ist gut erzählt jedoch recht kurz.
Soundtrack ist herausragend beinhatlet sogar KI2.
Die Kombos sind verdammt schnell was das SPielgeschehen sehr dynamisch macht.
Jedoch verbraucht sich die Euphorie doch recht rasch.... 
auch die Endanimationen der Kämpfer sind teilweise nur in einer Variante vorhanden.
Gut sind die Goldskins.
Andere Dinge muss man mit KI Gold freischalten oder eben erspielen.
Mich kann das Spiel durchaus überzeugen,
Charaktere Überarbeitungen sind teilweise geschmackssache... 
gibt sogar einen Cameo Charakter.
die Shadowlord variante ist ganz nett, aber wirkt doch eher wie ein Schachspiel.
Ein guter Prügler der sich jedoch zu rasch wiederholt.
Online spiel habe ich nicht getestet, da ich hauptsächlich VS und Story missionen gespielt habe.
Preislich mit 40€ in Ordnung 7€ für den Soundtrack der sehr elektronisch ist.
Da das Spiel ein Launchtitel für die xbox one war, war es auch recht lange exclusiv nur dort zu haben, daher freut es mich, dass es auch für PC erschien.
Lief technisch gesehen bis auf ein paar wenige Framedrops stetig bei 60fps.
Ein paar Soundbugs sind mir aufgefallen, wie gelegentliches pfeifen und stottern.
Ach ja und die Ladezeit der Kämpfe verlängert sich wenn man sämtliche Details auf Hoch eingestellt hat. Hier und da braucht auch die Menüführung etwas länger bzw. hat ein paar wenige Fehler.
Controllerunterstützung ist sowohl mit ps4 controller wireless als auch mit xbox360 contoller wired hervorragend.

40072538.review:
Знаете, что мне эта игра больше всего напоминает? Какой-то очень брутальный тренинг личностного роста: "Давай ты сможешь! Super! Соберись, измени жизнь к лучшему! Brutal! Стань лидером! Ultra!!!".

Последствия от такого тренинга,  из-за очень жесткого столкновения с реальностью, тоже очень похожи. Ободренный бесконечными похвалами от компьютера о том, как же у меня все хорошо получается, решив сразится с живым соперником, я, еще ни в одном файтинге не чувствовал такой беспомощности и не понимания происходящего на экране.

Т.е. порог вхождения у Killer Instinct одновременно и низкий, и высокий. Что отчасти объясняет множество глупых отзывов на нее в стиме, о том как им всем легко. Уважаемые... люди, пожалуйста, не пишите ничего, если даже в виртуальном мордобое минимально разобраться не можете.

Персонажей много, большая их часть совершенно по-разному чувствуется, и на то, чтобы понимать, что конкретно творит ваш персонаж и, что вам стоит ожидать от соперника, уйдет значительно больше времени, чем в MK или SF. Имейте это ввиду.

При этом большое количество контента для одного игрока: пока сюжет (скорее маленькие кусочки истории) осилите; пока наиграетесь с режимом "владыки теней", где вам "очень ненавязчиво"  будут предлагать дополнительно потратить еще реальных денег (ни одному вменяемому человеку, по-моему, этого делать не стоит); пока как следует подеретесь с такими же нубами, жмущими на все кнопки подряд - проведете часов 25-30 с удовольствием.

Отдельно хочу еще отметить лабораторию теней - это что-то вроде промежутка между однопользовательским режимом и онлайном, где вы создаете виртуальную копию себя, которую могут вызвать на бой другие люди, даже когда вас нет в игре, или вызвать на бой чужие. Штука это, конечно, даже близко не идеально работает, но любопытна и ранее нигде не встречалась.

Хорошая игра! У меня нет к ней никаких претензий, кроме того, что я, скажем так too old для того, чтобы всерьез тренироваться играть в файтинг.

39993756.review: Having played fighting games since the early '90s, and having played the original KI on SNES and dumping weeks worth of allowance at the arcade cabinet of the original...my feelings on this release are pretty positive.  The timing of combo breakers in this one is more akin to a parry in the Soul Calibur games, and the combo system is pretty intuitive with a basic tutorial.  I believe that the Steam platform release is a breath of fresh air, unlike the nickle-and-dime approach used in the initial release.  I'd like to see some DLCs for this in the future, as it can very well stand with the likes of MKX and SFV.

39940687.review:
Even though I a a fan of fighting games, I mostly play them casually and I am not a big fan of the endless huge combos in some of them (a few hits are ok, but a chain of gazillion hits???!). Not to mention that I am not that good with combos. So even though i liked the older Killer Instinct I must admit I was afraid and a bit skeptical if i would enjoy this one too or it would end up being a bad purchase based only on rose-tinted nostalgia glasses simply because I once liked to mash buttons with Orchid.

  Oh boy, I was wrong. The game is excellent and very beginner/user friendly. You can imagine my smile when i managed to end a round with a 64-hit Ultra Combo.

The controls are also superb, and perhaps it's the only western made fighting game that I feel did an amazing job with the animations and fuidity of motions and inputs, resembling the japanese style and feel of games like Street Fighter and not the more stiff (for example NRS's Mortal Kombat games) style of inputs. I don't mind either style, but my preference is the Japanese one. Uh, does that make sense? Whatever!  

  So yeah, get this game! A refreshing experience with a heavy focus on fast paced combos, a totally different feel from other fighting games, with an amazing cast, lots of single and multiplayer contact, ALL dlc available in game without any need for further purchase, amazing soundtrack (seriously go get it too, it includes not only tunes of the new game but from the two previous as well!)

39497099.review:
Disclaimer - Dieses Review dient nur für den Singleplayer Modus

Story - Schlecht wie bei fast jedem Beat em up...

Gameplay - viele verschiedene Modi und viele Characktere die sich alle anders Spielen, ein interessantes Kampfsystem und viele Challenges die es zu meistern heißt. 
Ein Level Up System für deinen Account UND für die jeweilgen anderen Characktere, offline und online wird nicht getrennt!
Kampfsystem ist leicht zu lernen und schwer zu meistern mit guter Lernkurve.

Grafik - Die Characktere und die Umgebung sind gelungen und die verschiedenen Welten (21 Stück) werden nicht langweilig da der Hintergrund "lebendig" ist (kann nicht den Kampf beeinflussen)

Musik - Jede Stage hat einen eigenen Soundtrack, den man aber durch den Retro Soundtrack ersetzten kann soweit man diesen freigeschaltet hat, der Soundtrack an sich ist für Beat em Up verhältnisse sehr gut (Halt kein Super Smash Bros. dennoch sehr gut)

Steuerung - Angriffe werden wieder ala Street Fighter ausgeführt ↓↘→ nur funktioniert das hier um einiges besser als im bekannten SF.
Mit der Kombohilfe können Anfänger schneller ins geschehen und ohne dieser Hilfe können Profis sich von den Anfängern abheben, da man ohne dieser Hilfe viel mehr Möglichkeiten hat.

Pros:

+ Großer Charackter Rooster
+ Durch die Modis viel Singleplayer Spielspaß
+ Gutes Map Design mit passender Musik
+ Alle Chars spielen sich verschieden
+ Leicht für Einsteiger ins Spiel zu kommen
+ Viel Luft nach oben für Profis

Cons:

- Vieles geht einfacher wen man echtes Geld ins Spiel (noch zusätzlich) reinsteckt
- Schwachsinnige und langweiliger Storyplot
- (für online Spieler) Online kaum/keine aktivität


Fazit - Es ist ein sehr gutes Beat em up, was mich zu meiner Verwunderung sehr überrascht hat (im positiven), wer ein Spiel ala Street Fighter x Mortal Kombat spielen will (was sich besser Steuert) ist hier genau richtig.
Die Vielfalt an verschiedenen Modi, schönem Map Design und Charackter Vielfalt, lässt das Spiel nicht so schnell langweilig werden.

Würde ich es empfehlen? Ja, ich hab es im Sale gekauft und würde ehrlich gesagt keine 37€ dafür zahlen aber für 25€ oder weniger ist das Spiel (in meinen Augen) ein muss. 
Da man 2 Std Zeit hat das Spiel umzutauschen würde ich euch den Versus Modus ans Herz legen und dazu die Characktere: Riptor, Hisako und Maya.

39477088.review:
The best fighting game ever, specifically when it comes to playing human opponents. No other game comes close to providing the thrilling tug of war of the minds The Killer Instinct provides.

Since ranked is only tied to steam players only, when ranked matches arent popping off, just hit ranked where you'll find tons of players on the xbox live ecosystem where the player base has been building for about 4 years.

Truly a great game and a great deal here on steam.

Coming from the xbox/win10 versions, the best part of the steam version is the fact that you have complete access to all of the characters offline!

Another great thing about the steam version is that you can play on laptops without the AC adapter plugged up. For some reason the Windows 10 version requires the AC adapter to be plugged up otherwise the game runs incredibly sluggish and is unplayable.

Make sure you check out the best KI guide at http://ki.infil.net and do the dang dojo mode! Character breakdowns of many of the characters are available with a search of YouTube. These are in depth introductions to the characters and show how they are meant to be played.

I almost forgot to mention one of the reasons that people will be playing this game for quite some time. Killer Instinct has an extremely diverse cast. No two characters play alike and that makes for an amazing amount of replay value as you learn all of the different matchups. It's great!

Fight on!

39355905.review:
U-L-T-R-A- C-O-M-B-O-

Oh man, where to start with this gem! This is such a great game for anyone who is into the fighthing genre. Competitive and casual players are going to love this fighthing game. I feel like it's a fighting game that is easy to play and learn, but hard to master. I know a lot of people are complaining about the online population, but there is so much more to this game than the online experience. Me personally, I haven't had any issues finding online games to jump into. 

There are ranked matches, casual matches and there is also a Shadow Lords online game mode as well. I only have 3 hours on record, but i played the hell out of it on the XBOX ONE when it was in season one. I got it when it was on sale for $20 and couldn't resist the price because you get all of the Skins and characters on Steam. I really love the unique character designs in this game too. Let's also not forget about the LIT SOUNDTRACK. Those who enjoy the upbeat Dubstep and Heavy Metal will enjoy the soundtrack in this game. 

You have individual stories for each charcter that you can play with. They are kind of short, but give you a really neat backstory on that specific character. There is another story mode called Shadow Lords where the ultimate goal is to beat Gargos and his forces before they take over the world! Before starting Shadow Lords you get to choose one character for your team leader and then you recruit other K.I. fighters to fight alongside of you. You also have upgrades and companions that will fight alongside of you to boost individual stats to give you an edge over fighting against the mimics. Mimics are evil versions of the Killer Instinct characters and you have to defeat them to get to Gargos. 

I also forgot to mention that there are extra story missions that you can play in Shadow Lords with specifc characters to learn more about their backstory. There are also daily rewards that you can earn and use in the Shadow Lords game mode. If you aren't the biggest fan of online, there are tons of single player options out there for you! The fighting mechanics of this game remind me of Street fighter. If you are decent at Street Fighter, I think you will get the hang of this game in no time! Such an underrated fighting game guys, you should pick it up if you can $20 or not! 

Hope this helped a lot of you guys out!

39343249.review:
Killer Instinct è un gioco di combattimento uno contro uno combattimento con le dinamiche di attacco in stile Street Fighter e si ispira anche sulle dinamiche di Mortal Kombat. Però, è un gioco che ha diverse caratteristiche che lo distinguono dagli altri come per la sua doppia barra di energia. Invece di vincere su due turni, ogni giocatore ha due barre di energia. Se un personaggio termina la prima barra di energia, la lotta si ferma e riprende con un nuovo e ultimo round. Il giocatore che esaurisce la seconda barra di energia vince l’incontro.
Un’altra caratteristica particolare in killer Instinct è la sua combinazione automatica delle mosse. Anziché premere i pulsanti necessari per fornire i singoli attacchi che formano una Combo, sono automatizzate e possono essere attivate con un pulsante determinato o mossa speciale per iniziare una serie di colpi. Le mosse finali somigliano alle Fatality di Mortal Kombat e servono per finire l’avversario in maniera violenta. Queste mosse non possono essere eseguite alla fine di una combo, è praticamente una “combo Ultimate”. Quando la seconda barra di energia avversaria lampeggia in rosso, si può effettuare la combo ultimate. A differenza di una fatality di Mortal Kombat, questa combo finale in Killer Instinct non comporta la morte o lo smembramento dell’avversario. L’ultra Combo è un’altra combo finale che permette al personaggio di eseguire una lunga serie di combo che di solito, durante l’incontro non supera i 20 colpi. Questa combo finale può raggiungere e superare anche i 100 colpi.Graficamente molto bello, a chi piace questo genere di gioco lo consiglio !

39303324.review:
I've noticed that this game is fairly low on Steam in the popularity department and I can't help but ask myself why?  It's truly an amazing game.  From a single player perspective there is just a TON of content.  I've only got about 15 hours of playtime in the game so far and I haven't even scratched the surface at this point.  The graphics are just amazing and it's such a fun game to play.  I think I saw one review that said it was a single button fighter and that couldn't be further from the truth.  You stick to one button and you're going to get combo broken constantly.

I'll admit that I the biggest complaint about this game is that there aren't a lot of people playing online.  Hopefully getting good word of mouth out will change that.  I'm not very good when it comes to online, but I still had fun playing it.  There's a shadow mode where you are basically playing AI controlled characters that are designed by other players for those that are wary of online.

The only other slight negative that I can see is that there are micro-transactions in this game.  That's a valid complaint, but compared to other games that use them, I don't think it's a major component here really.  Honestly I couldn't even see a good reason to buy any KI gold.  So I can get special skins maybe?  It definitely doesn't give you a competitive advantage, so easily ignored.  This game has only been out for a few months now and already has been on sale multiple times for $20.  It's well worth that price and even the full price of $40 isn't bad.  If you like other fighters like Street Fighter, you'll most likely be pleasantly surprised at how good this game is.

39202523.review:
For those not aware, Killer Instinct is a 2D fighting game series from the 90s and originally appeared on arcade and the Super Nintendo [and Game Boy but no one cares about that port so lets just carry on].  Beyond the original and its sequel KI2 a couple years later, this series fell to the wayside from the crossfire of the developers being bought out by Microsoft & left dormant.  It was brought back from the dead with this release in 2013 for the Xbox One, and since then has been continually updated to include new characters, stages, and modes.

The Steam version of KI is essentially the definitive edition, but without the Xbox integration.  You CAN play with those on the console as well as the Windows 10 release on all modes except for ranked.  So as long a the player count on the other systems remain active, you should have nothing to worry about.  That being said, they make it really hard to play with friends not on Steam.  The only way is thru Lobby Mode, it has to be public, and you have to make the requirements very specific or else a random may come aboard and hijack your lobby.

But enough with the negatives!  This game has all 29 different characters and 464 achievements!  The majority of them are character specific, so the format should be easy to follow, but you might get lost in the shuffle.  Technically there are microtransactions in the form of KI Gold, but they're really only used for cosmetics and you can just grind for them.  The gameplay itself focuses on making as large a combo as possible.  You also got combo breakers to stop your opponents from doing the same to you, but if you mess up you will be locked out and have to wait till the combo is finished (or you are dead).

There are several modes, including but not limited to: 
[list]
[*] Two different story modes (normal and Shadow Lords)
[*] Dojo for learning the basics
[*] Shadow Labs - fighting other player's "ghost" character
[*] The Normal Versus and Multiplayer that every single fighting game has and will always include
[/list]

Might I repeat, this is the definitive edition and have everything included already.  No additional purchases are necessary.

KI on the SNES was the first fighting game I owned, but I did not understand how the genre worked at the time so I missed out on the whole 90s craze.  But today is a different time, and I have been following how fighting games evolved and innovate over the past decade.  Beyond games like Mortal Kombat, there are few western fighting game series that have reached prominence.  Killer Instinct is one of those series, and I would not recommend skipping on this one.

39040230.review:
Я пробовал играть в стритфайтер и в мортал комбат, но настоящую ностальгию у меня взбудоражил именно KI. Про саму игру я узнал в далеких 90-х годах по передаче на ТВ с Супоневым, потом еще был журнал по компьютерным играм. А потом став обладателем SNES каким-то чудом мне досталась эта игра на поиграть. Помню как в те времена еще получались самые лютые ULTRA комбо, когда ты делаешь половину ударов, а потом игра сама за тебя добивает противника. Смотрелось это сказочно. Однако сама игра начинала жизнь на игровых автоматах, но то дела совсем далеких времен.
В новом ремейке давно забытой классики переработали дизайн персонажей, упростили комбо, а саму площадку (как я заметил это новая тенденция всех файтингов) уменьшили в габаритах. На SNES было больше "воздуха", тут все весьма плотно, зато персонажи на пол-экрана. Расширился список персонажей - многих я вижу в первый раз. Для всех персонажей спец-удары выполняются одинаково - вниз-диагональ-в сторону+удар. Но что поделать, казуализация является нетъемлемой частью большинства массовых игр.
Для тех кто впервые познакомился с игрой хочу сказать она не так проста как кажется на первый взгляд. У каждого персонажа есть история, у турнира KI своя подоплека, познакомится с ней - вполне достойное развлечение. Определенно она для меня значит больше чем все другие файтинги, рекомендую!

38806235.review:
I only recently discovered this game... I'd watched videos on Youtube, but never had the chance to play it myself due to both not owning an XBox One or a computer capable of running the game.  After getting a new computer that actually could, I recently downloaded the Windows Store version to take it for a spin, and absolutely loved it.  Purchased the Steam version as my holiday gift to myself on Boxing Day, and I'm still loving it.  The game feels like a bit of a decent middle ground in terms of ease of learning between Netherrealm fighters (like Injustice and Mortal Kombat) and the difficulty of Capcom fighters (like Street Fighter and Marvel vs. Capcom).  This is definitely a good fighting game to cut your teeth on, and I can't recommend it enough.

ADDENDUM: I felt the need to add this to this review.  The ranked online ladder in this version of the game is NOT cross-play with the XBox/Windows Store version, unlike all other online modes.  Which means that it's only Steam players that you'll encounter in ranked.  Whether or not this will change in the future is unknown, but if ranked battles matter to you, then you should take that into consideration when buying.  All that said, I still highly recommend this game.

38707391.review:
The single best current fighting game available, especially on PC.

Why it's great:
-Extremely varied cast of unique characters, both in terms of visuals/themes and gameplay mechanics
-Easy to learn, ungodly hard to master mechanics, insane depth usually reserved for Japanese fighting games (but without the huge barrier of entry)
-Netcode is perfect, easily Guilty Gear/Blazblue quality
-Cross-play with Xbox One and Windows 10 versions on nearly every mode, meaning playerbase is not an issue
-Unmatched audio/visual presentation combined with gameplay pacing makes the game a joy to watch and makes you feel amazing playing it
-Some of the best audio I have ever heard in any game, soundtrack hits you like a truck and never lets off, reactive songs and effects almost dynamically turns the gameplay itself into music
-A huge amount of content including a strategy/RPG campaign to keep you busy even offline 
-Shadow AI system is brilliant, accurately (and scaringly even) translates individual player habits into AI versions of themselves. Feels like you are playing online, best practice tool I've seen in any fighting game since the AI will actually replicate strategies used in the online meta and adapt.
-Tutorials and training modes are actually helpful when getting anyone into fighting games, including complicated concepts you often don't see represented in-game in other fighting games such as mixups and frame data (for every single move in the game)

What's not so great:
-Ranked mode is the only mode without crossplay for some reason in the Steam version. Don't buy it for this. (Though even on  Xbox most people do not play ranked as it's not very good, so you are fine)
-Some of the season 2 and especially season 1 ending unlock conditions for the story modes are ridiculously badly designed, such as Sadira's endings. You'll know what I mean if you try to go for them.
-The changes in development between each season leaves you with an inconsistent experience when it comes to story and other offline modes. Certain modes are only available to certain characters because of this. However the season 3 campaign features every character.

Overall it's easily becoming my favorite fighting game of all time, and on PC it's VERY underrated. Just get it.

38667264.review: When it came to the mid-90's fighters Killer Instinct and KI2 were my main go-to's on any given day.  This new Killer Instinct is incredible!  TL:DR Best modern fighter to date.  As far as fighting games go, even against the big tournament fighters, this one stands tall with the rest of them!  It's easy to learn, it's fun to play, it's not rage-inducing but offers constant rewards for what you put into it.  Shadow Lords is the centerpiece to this one - a sort of fighter/adventure story mode with buffs, familiars, healing items and the such.  Microtransactions are optional here and XP is about the only thing that fast-tracks any player to anything thankfully.  XP only unlocks character skins and despite the boosters that can be purchased it doesn't effect the gameplay.  Large character roster and fighting styles to master with a combo system that is both rewarding and accessible without too much hand holding (which is also optional).

38507087.review:
It's one hell of an amazing game, okay, maybe not, but it's really good anyway, totally worth it.
First of all, it has a decent amount of characters for such game, same could be said about the stages.
Characters are really amazingly well made, in the sense that they're fun to use, they're either original or simply epic.
Music is great in my opinion.
Microtransactions are cancer, yes. But do not mind them (in this game) because you can earn everything normally and it doesn't seems to take ages like other games that have microtransactions.
Microtransactions shouldn't be in paid games nor should they exist but it's almost as if they did not exist in this game.
This game started as a free2play game so it's understandable, sure, they should have changed it and removed the microtransactions but at least, it's not as cancerous as for example, games from Ubisoft, EA Games or pretty much every developers that uses microtransactions.
So do not take attention to the microtransactions! Just forget about them, play the game normally and have fun!
Combos breakers, combos, gameplay itself is awesome, 
If you have played the 94 version, you'll probably love this one, maybe even more.
It has customization, doesn't have much like Tekken or even Soul Calibur games but it's pretty cool anyway, no problem here.
Difficulty-wise, it's pretty easy on easy and medium, higher difficulties will requires some training, and you also got your Online mode which doesn't have many players but is still alive though.
You can activate or deactivate combo aassists which is a good thing for people who just want to play or practice before learning it the hard way.

I do not regret my purchase, I am happy that the game came on Steam, otherwise I would never have bought it, I was interested by it back when it was only available
through the Windows store but I did not want to give my money to Microsoft, I've done it enough already.

8/10 - If this had gore and brutalities, it would definitely be better than Mortal Kombat, it already is, but it's different, can't be compared, but I'd buy this over the crap they call Mortal Kombat X anyday.

38275781.review:
Крайне волшебно. Восхитительно. Рекомендую всем, попробовать как минимум стоит, но если вы ждете глупое заучивание комбинаций ударов, как в других файтингах, то Вам не сюда. 9 зонящих рипторов из 10.

Год облизывался на КИ (терпеть не могу джойстики, играть на приставке было не вариант), смотрел Макса Дуда и ждал. В итоге она вышла на ПК на 10 винде и это было ужасно. Лютейший донат + постоянные проблемы с подключением к серверам с пк. Поиграл в Лордах и забросил, ибо людей не искало. И вот она вышла в стиме и это настоящий подарок, по крайней мере для меня.

Плюсы: 
1. ЦЕНА. 700 рублей и Вы получаете весь контент. Все. Катайте в свое удовольсвтие. В магазине мелкософта за такую версию надо выложить 2500 (или около того, уже не помню точно). Купить что то отдельно у них - деньги на ветер. Очень дорого. И не факт, что будет нормально искать игроков.
2. Сервера стим. Ничего не лагает, никаких обрывов, все волшебно.
3. Игра ОЧЕНЬ расположена к новичкам, но при этом хардкорные игроки тоже найдут для себя огромные возможности. Комбо-ассист позволяет получать людям удовольствие от игры, не заучивая горы комбо и таймингов, а когда захочется углубиться в игру, то игрок обнаружит отличное обучение, даже описание приемов, чуть ли не с советами. 
4. Сама система боя. Вспомните допустим мортал или стрит файтер, вот вы выучили связки, ждете ошибку соперника и спамите связкой ударов, это примитивно и очень быстро надоедает. Здесь же у каждого персонажа есть минимум по 2 стиля игры (риптор к примеру. можно просто зонить противника, а можно и агрессивно его жрать) и Вы сами выбираете, как провести комбо и какой конечностью бить. Брейкеры же разжигают "битву умов" и игра умножает свою глубину.
5. Много режимов игры. Теневые Лорды вообще божественны, реально может затянуть. И вообще очень много контента. Те же "сетики", как в доте, одевай своего персонажа, как тебе нравится, в любой комбинации шмоток.
6. Доступна на семерке. Для многих это огромный плюс.
7. Ну и конечно же музыка от Мика Гордона. В этой игре лучший саундтрек, который я слышал вообще в играх.

Минусы:
1. Низкий онлайн в не-прайм тайм. Конечно ближе к вечеру очень быстро находит людей, но в основное время довольно пустынно.
2. Изза малого количества людей, игры по рейтингу не сбалансированы. Вас может кидать на Киллера в самом начале и Вы будете страдать. Сильно.

Очень жаль, что игра непопулярна, она заслуживает гораздо большего.

38226568.review:
I  <3  KI

Last time I played this game was on the SNES (it came much after MK, which is a classic, but KI had more character, creativity and imagination). KI was awesome then and remains so, with this modern release, which is mostly true to the original. That being said, there are some differences with the way some of the old characters sound and feel, but nothing that severely affects the gameplay; (eg: Spinal's new theme/song is lame, his voice/ sounds rendering/ animation/ posture are way less creepy and effective. He feels like he was taken from Pirates of the Caribbean, as some neutral, watered-down ghost hero - being both wholesome & family-friendly - not some blighted supernatural entity whose general purpose is to have you soil yourself).

A lot of the dark and spooky qualities of the SNES standard have been lost along the way, but I'm glad the franchise has survived to a modern PC release, so that new players can at least experience some of the greatness that was/is Killer Instinct.

37986160.review:
KI is a really solid 2D fighter that Iron Galaxy did a terrific job with, creating an incredibly unique combo system that is very simple to pick up yet has enough depth to satisfy people familiar with the genre.

+6 button control scheme identical to Street Fighter/Skullgirls (3x punch/3x kick)
+Basic combo flowchart of hitconfirm -> opener -> auto double -> linker -> auto double -> ender which can change on a character by character basis but remains rather constant throughout the cast.
+The combo breaker is easily the biggest hit or miss feature about the game solely because this game will nearly always at some point give the player being hit to break out of the combo if they correctly guess the strength of the move the other player is using (i.e if I use Jago M auto doubles, if you press MP+MK within a small window you'll be let out of my combo). However, this system is offset by a state called "lockout" where if you've already guessed wrong on a combo break, the other player has their freedom with you like a traditional combo for a little bit. It's a great risk/reward system imo.
+Character variety is all over the place. Very solid roster at this point with most playstyles being catered to.
+In depth tutorial covers everything from basic mechanics to real match situations.
+Netcode is arguably the best out of any modern fighter.
+Exhibition has crossplay capability with Windows 10 and Xbox One versions.
+A super rare fighting game with actual single player content! Wild, right?

-Ranked has no crossplay (WHY???) and is relatively dead once you hit Gold or Killer.
-Playing with a specific user on Xbox One or Win10 is a total shitshow and I've never gotten it to work successfully.

9/10, it's a good game

37867181.review:
Esta versión de Killer Instict es mucho más frenética que sus antecesores de SNES y N64, además de que puedes variar los combos como a ti te guste, no como antes que variar los combos estaba muy limitado, o si te salías del "molde" perdías el combo; ya tenía algo de experiencia pero con solo probarlo me dí cuenta que cualquiera puede aprender rápido y eso invita a que otros amigos se animen a jugarlo, a diferencia de otros títulos que son más complicados de aprender (evitaré mencionar nombres, por respeto al trabajo de los desarrolladores).

Otro detalle que distingue a un Killer Instinct es el Soundtrack y debo decir que este me encantó, el tema de Tusk y Cinder entre otros son excelentes, aunque el nuevo tema de Sabrewulf me dejó que desear, supongo que la versión de SNES ya había dado su paso épico desde el comienzo. Otro detalle es que a mi por lo general no me gusta el Dubstep, pero la forman en que lo implementan en este Soundtrack es muy disfrutable.

Los Ultimates tienen potencial, pero pudieron haber sido mucho mejores, estan muy censurados. 

No me hice expectativas de esta versión en un principio, pero para un juego de peleas es que trae mucho contenido, me sorprendió bastante cuando finalmente lo probé.

En general el juego es excelente, no puedo dejar de jugarlo, el gameplay esta muy refinado y pulido, tiene bastante potencial adictivo, me encantó. Muchas gracias por adaptarlo a Steam, por un momento pensé que nunca lo jugaría porque a mi ya no me interesan las consolas.

For a great 2d fighting game like Killer Instinct to go from F2P to a complete package with ignorable microtransaction crud. KI is a diamond in the rough. KI sets itself apart from others in it's genre by eliminating that frustrating paywall that other franchises chose to use. (I'm lookin' at YOU Capcom!)

Graphics are great, polished no complaints.

Gameplay is what you'd expect from any fighting game. Good ol' Fist to Cuffs game where combos are manditory, flashy yet tactical without making the matches boring to watch. If you like lots of grappling in your fighting game then this may not be your cup of tea. Each character has a front and back throw. (except maybe 1 or 2 of them) Expect more of trying to get in to do a crazy combo when the opportunity arises or break the combo coming your way.

Overall it's a pretty straight forward fighter that doesn't stray far from it's roots and has feature that are "newcomer friendly".

37668717.review:
Когда впервые увидел трейлер Killer Insinct, он почему-то меня зацепил, я увидел в нём то, что никогда не видел в файтинге. И знаете, я вообще не ошибся. Игра действительно стоит статуса ''эксклюзива", она спокойно может заставить и оправдывает покупку консоли, но не Xbox'a :) 

Итак, чем же игра так хороша, начнём по пунктам:

1) Тонна контента - игру обновляли 3 года, пока вышли все 3 сезона с бойцами, за это время добавили много чего, есть множество различных модов, одиночный режим.
2) Система комбо, прерыватели комбо, теневой режим.
3) Визуальный стиль.
4)Все арены анимированы,дико вставляют, вечно что-то происходит на фоне.
5) Саундтрек, отдельно заслуживает внимания.
6) Лучшая система обучения в файтингах.
7) Шикарный сетевой код, вообще никаких проблем в онлайне.
8) Кастомизация персонажей - действительно крутая вещь, много разнообразных одежек и красок для ваших персонажей.
9) Комментатор, который озвучивает ваши комбо, орёт УЛТРАААА ВО весь голос, он просто лучший, без него игра была бы не настолько крутой.
10) Цена, за такую проделанную работу, это просто копейки.


ЕСТЬ И МИНУСЫ, ЭТО ж МелкоСофт, всегда найдут где облажаться.

1) Нету РАНКЕД Кросс-плея между СТИМ версией и Xbox,есть обычные матчи, там в основном челики с Xbox live, вечно играем с ними.
2) Нельзя активировать уникальные цвета для героев, для Windows Store и Xbox в твиттере вечно разыгрывают цвета героев , которые недоступны в игре, их нельзя применить к стим версии, ибо видите ли, у нас не привязан Microsoft аккаунт, поэтому фиг нам.
3) Поддержка игры - до сих пор с момента релиза ждём карточки, прошло 2 месяца уже как бэ, люди просят ранкед кросс-плей, для игры нету обновлений вообще, 1 раз была, когда сломался 1 из модов, разработчики молчат везде.
4) Поддержка геймпадов почти отсутствует, я пробовал подключать копеечный геймпад, игра его не видит, я человек простой- захотел поиграть, включил игру, подключил геймпад, уже играю, тут к сожалению, это не работает.
На клаве вполне комфортно играть, если у вас геймпад от Xbox, у вас вообще не будет проблем с ним.
5) Не хватает разнообразия анимаций и реплик персонажей в начале боя/ в конце.

Просто поясню, почему этот файтинг заслуживает внимания, чем же он так хорош.
В стим версию входят все бойцы,  костюмы открываются при получения конкретного уровня, 
Он лёгок для освоения, комбо может делать каждый, их не надо заучивать, можно просто жать на кнопки и персонаж за вас всё сделает.
Я действительно не понимаю, почему люди игнорируют этот файтинг, как по мне, он точно лучше нового Теккен'а, я бы даже поставил его выше МК, в стрит файтер я не играл вообще.
Насчёт людей в онлайне, почти все на форуме пишут: мол не с кем поиграть, игра мертва. Лично я просто захожу в обычную игру в онлайн, там все челики с xbox live сидят, находите примерно равного вам и играете, я спокойно за заход играл до 20 матчей с 1! человеком, вообще никаких проблем.
Я бы посоветовал это файтинг всем любителям жанра, игра особенно хороша для ознакомления с жанром файтингов, контентом можно просто обмазаться от разнообразия всяких модов, да и просто бои дико доставляют.
Очень надеюсь, что мы увидим продолжение с увеличенным бюджетом!

37589159.review:
Killer Instinct is the revival of a long-gone fighting game series spanning back to the SNES, and finally comes to steam! The series is well known for being a conventional fighting game, with more of a push towards high combo strings and being as flashy as possible. One of the main features to create this remains, in the auto-double system - allowing the player to input certain buttons in sequence to perform longer combos semi-automatically. In order to suit the game more to the common person, they have also added an optional feature, called the "Combo Assist" mode, which allows the player to simply press a button alone to help them in their combos, instead of entering complex motions. However, the player will still have to enter special move inputs to start combos. The comboing system in KI3 has been set into specific segments of the combo for the player to remember. They start of their combos with an Opener, which will link into an auto-double, then they can either input a linker move (which will then lead into another auto-double) or they can end their combo with an ender move, which will deal the most damage, and will take away all potential damage through the combo. You can also link a linker to a linker to an ender, but you will have to keep the combo short enough so that the enemy does not break out of it, due to another system which measures the amount of damage given in a combo.

This is all backed up by an incredible soundtrack produced by Mick Gordon, Celldweller and Atlas Plug, all presented in the battle through a dynamic music system, with all the songs eventually reaching their culmination in a huge automatic ULTRA COMBO. You cannot forget the awesome work by the announcers in the different announcer packs which are unlockable, all providing the correct amounts of screams and shouts to get anyone pumping.

The visuals are nothing to sniff at either, with 3D models through the characters and the background stages being at a consistent texture quality that won't break your immersion at any time.

37440777.review:
Killer Instinct, is a game I've waited for a longtime to play on pc.
Finally Microsoft decided to release it on steam as an actual game that costs around 40 bucks (or you get it in the sales for around 18 bucks in the first week like me).

This game is, no surprise here, amazing;

The sound design is great, especially the announcer tends to shout out stuff that you're probably familiar with, like the famous "C-c-c-combobreaker" or "ULTRA COMBO". Besides that the hitsounds as well as all of the other stuff are well designed, no flaws here.

The gameplay is complex, but not too much.
I expected to be overwhelmed again like when I tried to play Guilty Gear. But this game has also an amazingly good tutorial that even teaches others basic fighting game techniques like mixups or trick throws and stuff like that which you won't learn up until you reach the point of someone telling you or experiencing it the hard way.
Nonetheless this game is pretty easy to get into but hard to master and has a high learning curve, with a lot of techniques you can use in battle that make the game more complex and deeper than some strategy games sometimes can be. The game is pretty fast paced so you'll be at home when you usually play games like Marvel vs Capcom or Guilty Gear, Street Fighter players might need to readjust quite some time until they learn at which pace you can go here without completely f*cking up.

And last but not least; the visuals
in short they're amazing, you might be distracted by the particles at first but it gets better as you progress learning this game. It is truly beautiful even on lower settings and really pretty to look at in general. People who like more realistic looking designs and graphics will feel at home here.

Overall this game is a solid 9/10
I would put it higher but I'm basing my ratings on a perspective, that even people who wouldn't usually play those kinds of games, can agree or understand why I gave it that rating. A must buy for combo lover and fighting game fans!

37432871.review:
Highly recommend.

As far as I can tell a great port of the XB1/Windows game. You unlock all fighters with purchase including the recently previously-limited Shadow Jago, and while Killer Instinct offers in-game purchases there really isn't a whole lot to buy, especially since you regularly unlock cosmetics, portraits, etc. for the characters you play. The netcode is solid; I played a handful of games so far against both PC and XB1 users and aside from some negligible startup lag on my first game it has run as well as a fighter ought to.

Since it is crossplay, a lot of the players you'll bump into have way more experience than you if Steam is your first time playing the game. Unfortunately while you can change your skill rating when searching for unranked matches, there is no way to raise the minimum difficulty meaning an unranked player on par with a Gold player can still sneak their way into your matches. That being said, the game is so much fun even complete stomps are a blast.

I also recommend looking up Infil's Complete Killer Instinct Guide if you are new. It does a great job of introducing the mechanics, and once you are done experimenting with what characters you prefer it has a pretty extensive but easy-to-digest breakdown of your characters strengths, weaknesses, and general playstyle.

No cross play in ranked to make up the difference = game DOA.If ranked play is what you are looking for, you will want to stick to the Xbone/Win10 version of the game. 

This is the games ONLY real CON. for what it is worth it is the 2nd best FG on steam, next to tekken 7. And this one is MUCH easier to pick up and play and get decent at. The learning curve isnt really as steep as alot of fighters, and you dont really need to worry about frame data and hit/hurt boxes like you do with SF/ tekken etc.... 

The SP game here has everything you could possibly want and then some, including t he verty best implemented story mode (Shadow Lords) ever. Playing against the AI in the hardest level is damn brutal. And as i was saying earlier, as long as you dont care about eranked, the MP experience is pretty solid as well. Netcode is stable and very fast even with lower pings. Gameplay is fast and furious, and the muisic is the very best music in any FG... PERIOD!

Controller support is limited to xinput, BUT with xbox360CE you can get right past that easily and use ANY controller your heart desires.

37273845.review:
杀手本能，无与伦比的一款好游戏。
且听我慢慢吹下牛逼：
我简单地说几点为什么。
1、游戏画面：人物和背景刻画细腻，画面风格科幻冷峻。尤其是打击时候的画面特效那个爽快。
2、游戏声音：激烈战斗再搭配激情无比的雄浑男声，一声声“combo breaker”、“shadow counter”、
“ultra！！！！！！！！”激起你的肾上腺素。
3、手感和打击感：手感完全无延迟，打击感单单听肉体碰撞的声音已经很不错，搭配解说，游戏声音，背景音乐简直是种享受。
4、格斗系统：说到这个话就长了。我就很简单说一下几个点吧。
a.基础格斗系统和街头霸王系列相仿，便于大家迅速进入节奏。
b.极其强大而又自由的格斗连招系统，什么浮空，什么空中再抓取等等，只有想不到没有做不到。
c.深度系统，比如“combo breaker”我翻译为“连招挣脱”，“shadow counter”我翻译为“暗影反击”，“counter breaker”
我翻译为“连招陷阱”；等等让人一旦上手就无法自拔的深度而又科学的系统。
d.每个角色个性化极其强大，都有各自的一套完整的作战系统和杀手潜能，简直是想象力爆炸。
5、网络！网络！网络！相信大家都是格斗游戏过来人，我可以放心告诉你。这是你现在所能玩到的联机效果最好的格斗游戏，没有之一。
6、游戏自定义内容极其丰富：细致又强大的教学模式，大故事模式，角色故事模式，人机对战炼狱模式，在线对战各种模式。商店服饰自由搭配，大数据离线AI
随你挑战。等等等等。
7、还有好多 我想到再补充吧。
最后简单说一下：这个游戏目前唯一不合适国内大众的就是全英文。但是当你熟悉了之后又有什么关系呢？
不懂的话你可以来问我呀！


ps：可能会有朋友说，你是什么人，才玩几个小时你就发表这些看似很牛逼的评论。
不好意思我只能介绍一下自己，我现在是火猫直播的一个小主播。主要播杀手本能。
我玩杀手本能也有几个月的时间了，之前一直是在win10和xbox平台。入steam版本
最主要的目的是和国内steam平台玩家更好地进行联机。顺便也是支持良心的游戏制作商。
我可能是国内杀手本能玩家中第一个上到杀手段位（最高段位）的玩家。。。。。。。
直播间地址：www.huomao.com/6794
有空来看看，相信你们的格斗视野会更加开阔。

36488950.review:
Увидев по телевизору геймплей Killer Instinct на SNES в начале 90-х, я мечтал поиграть в этот офигенный файтинг. Но SNES, как и картриджи для неё, были дико дорогими. Так что пришлось ждать около 20 лет, чтобы поиграть в Killer Instinct, но уже на PC через эмулятор. Я прошёл игру за TJ Kombo, самостоятельно (без гайдов) освоив комбо связки, таким образом реализовав свою давнюю мечту.

Сейчас у нас есть возможность играть в новый, графически улучшенный, но всё тот же замечательный брутальный и быстрый Killer Instinct. Игра хороша! Большой выбор бойцов, красивые динамичные бои и живописные арены. Плюс шикарный саундтрек.

Из минусов отмечу наличие некоторых больших бойцов, сделанных и анимированных не очень качественно, по сравнению с персонажами обычных размеров. Например огромный каменный великан. И ещё босс из самой первой части с разделённой надвое головой. Движения их смотрятся дёргаными (недостаточно плавными). Но это чисто субъективное мнение. Может быть вам их анимация придётся по душе.

В целом игра качественная. Рекомендую.

P.S. Не забывайте, что ваша игровая платформа - Windows от компании Microsoft. Поэтому не поленитесь обзавестись соответствующим контроллером, чтобы потом в своих отзывах не жаловаться на плохую совместимость игры с контроллерами от других фирм.

Absolutely AMAZING game!

90's western fighter aesthetics, combined with a Godlike - dynamic! - OST.

The fighting mechanics are fresh and so much different to other fighting games - and that's coming from someone who used to play Guilty Gear #R -> Accent Core Plus religiously!

36339871.review:
As a huge fan of the original Killer Instinct and the sequel (both of which were huge in arcades in the 1990's) I am deeply impressed with how much fun this modern remake it. It is authentic to the original Killer Instinct formula while adding some great new mechanics and the graphics and art design are phenomenal.

I resisted purchasing this game on the Windows Store because of the season-based DLC monetization strategy. I did not want to support it, and I don't want to purchase games on the Windows Store. Now that Killer Instinct is on Steam and includes all of the DLC, it is a great fighting game to recommend.

36287566.review:
Design:
First of all i would like to report a typo on the name "Killer Instinct" should be renamed to "Cuddling Instinct" since they removed the ultimates, humilliations and decent stage fatalities. The most we get is some dumb stage fatalities where the player get hit by a few furnitures and that's it...the others are even worse where they always fall into an object that causes massive particle spamm and pauses the game to prevent possible PG customers from seeing an imaginary dead person.
Also characters looks like theyre made of dildos i mean they shine and everything...

-KI2 had better graphics and design IMO-

Netcode:
Is great as long as you're not playing against people from steam, for some reason most times i play with steam players the game keeps freezing random disconnecting or having massive teleports, but i'll assume they're just on mommy's work laptop or stealing wifi... You know, hue hues

Gameplay:
Button masher combo assist based game. Avoid it unless you want to cringe finding max lvl players walking forward while randomly mashing weak punch trying to start their fave automatic 50% damage combo and see them rage quit as they fail...And bore yourself while doing it. Some people are max lvl and won't know how to block because they used their whole gaming time in developing their forward + weak punch spamm tactics.
Most people that's not going forward + weak punch spamm will do nothing but walk away, jump away, dash, teleport or fly away the entire fight until they get stuck on the wall doing the back + weak punch thing i just don't find this fun at all...

There is no way to filter combo assist boring fights and worst of all even if you disable combo assist it enables itself for no aparent reason at all, just saying...in case you actually want to think what you doing instead of button mashing the game forces combo assist on you randomly.


Single player:
I guess this is where it's at, it has many dumb foreveralone stuff to do but you also need to be online or it won't save but at this rate with that combo assist crap i think computer enemies feels more humans than the players themself.

Communication...
Finally a fighting game on PC where they didn't used the "we don't make a chat because people would be salty talking" to avoid creating a comm system...Here we have mandatory open mic wich would lead to hear people yelling stuff in forgotten tongues, loud background noise and the unavoidable bizarre sounds before people rage quits. You can mute them but you can't force your mic to be silent unless you use external methods like unplugging mic, installing third party push to talk programs or muting your recording driver. Still better than skullgirls or SFV. Also i do belive that steam users can't voice with xbox or console users

Spoiler: There are unbalanced safe-on-block spammable huge attacks. Some of them are even unblockable ROFLMAO!!

There are good mechanics like the combos, basically making the combo in the go trying to trick the other player in failing their combo breaker or tricking them into a counter breaker. That and  some characters has nice resets, whatever. This was the main reason i bought the game i was tired of those games where once the combo starts you're stuck in a very long animation turning the game into a trainging mode grinding trying to memorize the longest combo you can wich ends up being repetitive. Combos in this game does not feels repetitive at all

I like the game but can't recommend it to everyone.

36020108.review:
[b]Great modern fighter with an oldschool feeling!
This Killer Instinct is basically a revamped and modernized version of the classic games from the 90ies. [/b]

[h1] Roster[/h1]

One of the major complaints of people wjo played the originals was that every character kinda played the same. This time, the devs tried to add some depth to the gameplay by making character more unique. For example: Saberwulf is now a rushdown heavy character who haves a bad time dealing with projectiles, while Tusk is now a very slow but high damaging character; and some chars like Kan Ra and Glacius are kind of like Dhalsim from Street Fighter, that is: good at mid range pokes and setups. The most balanced all around char and the most suitable for beginners is Jago, who plays kinda like Ryu with his fireball and shoryuken zoning and also has the standard Killer Instinct combos.

[h1]Combo System[/h1]

The combo system seems to be kinda hard in the begining, but it’s actually pretty straightforward: you beging your combo with some special move, then you follow up with a regular attack (weak, medium or strong) and keep combining normal and special attacks until the combo gauge starts to reach the red line, then you perform a special attack with the heavy button to finish the combo. While taking damage, the opponent might guess which normal attacks you’re using as likers and the press the same buttons to perform a Ccccc-combo breaker. If he makes the wrong guess, he gets locked in the combo.
There is also an autocombo system, which allows you to mash buttons randomly and the CPU will perform the combos for you. But I strongly recommend you to turn off dat schit, cause you will never actually learn the game if you use it and also it will lead you nowhere online.

[h1]Visuals[/h1] 

As for the visuals, the game looks pretty good, even in a crappy PC like mine. I liked the new look of characters like Saberwulf and Orchid, but the new look of T.J. Combo and Glacius are kinda off. Fortunately, the game has tons of customization features for you char, one of them being the “classic skin”, suited for oldtimers. Another good thing about the customizations in this game is that they can all be earned through playing the game.

[b]Overall this is a pretty solid and fun fighter, I give it 4.6/5.0

36014063.review:
Then:
I've been hype af for this game since it was first announced as a launch title for the Xbox One.  The original Killer Instinct (or the SNES port of it, anyway) was one of the fighting games I always played with my cousin every time we got to hang out together.  It was always a requirement.  So I SO was ready and willing to board the hype/nostalgia train and get into the new version.  Season one was given to me as a gift from my brother-in-law, and I later snagged season two when it was free on XBLG.  As such, I didn't have the season three characters.  Now that the game's finished, however, and Killer Instinct has FINALLY come to Steam (I wasn't about to update to Windows 10 just to play the PC port of KI 'cuz screw dat) with all the content unlocked (give or take the things you have to earn, anyway) for $40.  The only way I could be happier is if I finally got to play it with my cousin again, like old times.

Now:
Now that I've got the hype and nostalgia out of the way, the game lives up to, and surpasses all expectations.  Killer Instinct has always had a unique, and simplistic combo flowchart (or you can play Sadira and play the up, down game if your execution's good enough), so the game, generally speaking, isn't that difficult, executionally.  Emphasis on executionally.  The real difficulty of the game comes from getting into your opponent's head, and making the right reads.

Combo and Counter Breakers:
In the older games, all you needed to do a combo breaker was the required special move input at the right time, so combo breaking was fairly easy.  In this game, they added a healthy level of risk to them.  Here, you have to press two buttons of the same strength as the button your opponent is currently hitting you with, and in time, you can learn to recognize or predict them, though you'll mostly be guessing at first.  However, if you guess wrong, you'll get locked out for a short period of time, during which you'll take extra damage and can't try combo breaking again.  Another thing to keep in mind about the risk of combo breakers is once your opponent figures out when you're going to break their combo, they can perform a counter breaker.  If they guessed that you were going to break the combo, and you don't, it just ends their combo prematurely, but if they did guess right, they can start a new combo from that point, in addition to the one they were already doing.  The KV (knockdown value) meter gets reset and you have to take a second combo on top of the initial one, and the damage skyrockets.

Final Thoughs:
This game is all about footsies, and risk and reward.  If you play/ed Street Fighter IV/V, and you wanna play a foosties heavy fighting game with flashy combos that let you look like you're better at the game than you really are (but the game is every bit as good as it looks -coughunlikeSFVcough-), YOU NEED TO BUY THIS GAME.  I can't stress/recommend this enough.  Review's over, you can stop reading now, just buy the game.

35914841.review:
Неожиданно и очень приятно видеть, что Microsoft решила отпустить Killer Instinct со своего штатного магазина гулять на просторы другой   площадки. Никто не ожидал такого поворота. Но уж лучше поздно чем никогда, ведь так? Да?

На «шайтан коробке» в KI играют с 2013. Несмотря на то что политика производителя операционных систем сменила курс с «Only for Xbox» на «штампуем туда и туда» большого ажиотажа в Steam третья часть уже подзабытого файтинга не снискала. Спасибо «Only for Windows 10» и эксклюзивности для его магазина ранее и недостатка рекламы к выходу Steam Edition.

Во всём остальном всё также просто ужасно. Ужасно прекрасно! Достаток однопользовательских режимом проглотит Ваше время и не подавиться. На выбор сюжетное прохождение, режим выживания, простые бои один на один. Также имеем Shadow Lord который в своё время был последним DLC, в котором нам предоставляют свою кампанию на прохождение с элементами крафта предметов и наградами за прохождение всевозможных миссий которые можно применять в бою или в не его для всяких бонусов и прочего.  Потерять тут десятки часов не составит никаких проблем.

Каждый персонаж, как и в своё время в середине 90-х полностью оригинален и неповторим. Все имеют свои плюсы и минусы, и при схватке с каждым из них всё это должно учитываться.  Боевая механика с прошлых частей конечно изменилась, но также, как и состав персонажей уникальна и неповторима, поэтому сравнить её с тем же MK или Tekken очень проблематично. Разумеется, тем, кто играл в прошлые игры серии по началу будут представлять из себя [spoiler]«ПУК-ПУК-ПУК (вставить картинку преклонного старца) – раньше было лучше, раньше было круче»[/spoiler]. Но по мере того как пролетают минуты и часы всем станет ясно, что это всё тот же Killer instinct который и был, но осовремененный для двадцать первого века.

Никак нельзя обойти стороной такой немаловажный аспект как музыкальное сопровождение. Всё абсолютно отлично. Каждая композиция своя и неповторимая для каждой схватки, подстраиваемая под происходящее на экране.
Отдельного упоминания также нельзя оставить очень глубокий Dojo Mode, он же тренировочный режим, где от и до расскажут и научат особенности механики боёв. Таких вводных курсов практически не сыскать в других файтингах, что очень поможет всем новичкам войти в курс дела.

Killer Instinct превосходное приобретение по прекрасной цене для всех ценителей виртуального мордобоя и ностальгирующих по оригинальным играм (кто-то помнит официальный турнир по KI где был ведущим Сергей Супонев? Нет? Ну ладно). В издание Steam включены все DLC которые выходили, кроссплатформенный мультиплеер и голос ведущего «С-С-Сombo Breaker!!!». Единственное что чуть-чуть огорчает так это то, что в отличии от владельцев Xbox, первые две части увы, так и остаются в заточении земель консольных.

35769103.review:
Killer Instinct ist ein großartiges fighting game welches ich nur empfehlen kann und anfängerfreundlicher ist als andere (dies kann ich persönlich aber nicht einschätzen da ich außer MKX kein anderes fighting game besitze).
Es besitzt für Anfänger sogar einen Combo-Assist Modus welcher die Eingaben die für Combos nötig sind reduziert. Dies gibt dir aber im vergleich zu jemanden der dies nicht nutzt den Nachteil dass deine Combos berechenbarer und da durch einfacher zu brechen sind.

KI ist eins dieser "easy to learn, hard to master" Spiele mit einen Tutorial  welches dir alles beibringt was du wissen musst und noch mehr.

Die Grafik ist etwas veraltet und die visuelle Qualität der Kämpfer und ihrer Animationen kann stark variieren.
So wirken z.B. die Animationen von Maya und TJ Combo steif, dagegen andere wie Riptor und Arbiter (Gast Charakter aus Halo) sind visuel und von den Animationen her super.
Zudem zoomt das Spiel leider viel zu oft auf die Charactere welches die matschigen Texturen nicht zu übersehen macht.

KI hat (wie alle andere fighting games) keinen standartmäßigen 21:9 support. Aber dafür kann man sich einen Fix runterladen: http://www.wsgf.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=64&t=32326

Was keiner bestreiten kann ist dass der Soundtrack von KI großartig ist.
Ich würde definitiv empfehlen die Killer Cuts Edition zu kaufen da man nicht nur den Soundtrack von Mick Gorden, Celldweller & Atlas Plug bekommt, sondern auch den der 2 alten KI Spiele, 68 großartige Lieder für nur 4€!

Falls ihr euch wegen dem KI Gold sorgen macht dass es Pay2Win sein könnte, fürchtet nicht!
Es lässt euch nur kosmetische Sachen früher freischalten außerdem kann man es auch durch Tägliches Spielen bekommen.

I've never felt more welcomed by a fighting game than I have by Killer Instinct. 

KI's tutorials, single-player content and wealth of beginner-friendly features has even a complete newbie like myself, who has some hefty multiplayer anxiety, feeling like I can go online and enjoy the game with other people.

35700602.review:
Killer Instinct finally makes its way to the PC where it belongs...STEAM! 

Single player wise, there is also a boat load of content available and those that don't want to play multiplayer can occupy themselves with Shadow Lords mode or even just a normal arcade mode against the PC. The included training mode is also highly detailed and shows you the ropes of the game. What makes KI truely exceptional for me is that fact that the game has a feature called "Combo Assist" which you can enable. If you're struggling to execute combos in fighting games (like I do) then this feature is awesome. Okay, some people or hardcore KI players do frown upon those that do use it, but trust me, there is nothing more satisfying than executing a combo in style and feel like a bad ass at the same time without needing to have the muscle memory of a super computer.

Multiplayer is a pleasant experience. The netcode is exceptionally good and the fact that you can crossplay with people on xbox one and Win 10 makes it bonus (excluding ranked matches though). Just to give you an idea of how good the netcode is, I live in South Africa and all matches that I've played have been smooth as a baby's bottom. The game also doesn't require a super computer to run and is optimized. If you love fighting games and want to support developers who bring their fighting games to PC, then buy KI, immediately. 

Trust me, you won't be disappointed!
