Ну, я начну наверное 
Как человек который довольно много времени играл в файтинги, сразу скажу- ОНА ХОРОША.
Система боёвки проще паренной репы, даже если у вас парализованные клешни, растущие из задницы. Вы ее поймете.
Музыка очень хорошо подобрана. Сразу видно что композитор славно потрудился, создавая эти саундтреки. Сочетание тяжелого рока, дабстепа и инструментальной музыки-довольно смелый и успешный подход.
Эпичные добивания от которых невозможно не раскрыть рот, после которых говорится заветное "ULTRAAAA COMBOOOO"
Персонажи довольно харизматичны (судя по виду). У каждого свой стиль боя и это радует. Режим истории не хорош, и не плох. Есть некоторые катсцены, но хотелось-бы чего то большего.

Многие ставят отрицательную оценку, потому что нет карточек. Их скоро добавят, но зачем из-за этого ставить плохую оценку?
Итог: Довольно хороший и веселый файтинг с простой боевкой и оригинальным подходом к саундтреку.
Если вы любитель подобного жанра игр, скорей ее покупайте, вы не разочаруетесь. 
Ставлю твердую четверку из пяти.

35662534.review:
If you're like me and you played the legendary SNES Killer Instinct as child in arcades than this is a must buy for you !
It has all the original charaters plus new ones from sequential games, and it is true to the original long combo system including Combo Breakers, Ultra combos and Stage Combos.

This game is easy to play, but hard to master, you need to develop skills generally for the combo system and for each character seperatly to master this game.
The good thing is the excellent Tutorial system, the story modes, and practice modes that will teach you the ins & outs of the combo system giving you all what you need to know to master this game.

The multiplayer is EXCELLENT !!! Planty of players online, eather in Exhibition mode (friendly fight), Competitive Mode (Ranked leagues) or Loby mode where bunch of player play in turns.
You have a filter system to filter of players by rank, making it possible to play against player your own lvl.

Shadows - apperantly this was introduced in KI in previous KI games that were only available on Xbox, now on PC.
This feature allows you to create a shadow for characters which basically you can update after your fights, creating a character that should mirror your skills and fight style. you can then fight your shadow character to even better yourseklf further. You can also play against other players shadow characters.

Killer Instict is brutal, intense, challanging and most of all FUN.
If your looking for a fighting game for PC and maybe your considering Tekken7, I say buy have no doubts this is the best fighting game for PC.

35636221.review:
Файтинг отличный. 
Боевая система продумана до мелочей и дает достаточно опций как для защиты, так и для атаки. Комбо система простая в своей теории (но сложная в познании до совершенства) , и даже если возникли проблемы, или не хочется вникать, то есть комбо ассист.
Есть отличное обучение правилам игры в целом, и механике игры за Джейго в частности. А вот обучение на других персонажей не завезли, сами учитесь (тут хочется вспомнить детальный комбо лист на каждого персонажа в Guilty Gear и укоризненно покачать головой).

История не шибко зажигательная, потому что стори мод - это режим аркады с маленькими, прямо таки микроскопическими  катсценами, да и завезли его только на персонажей первых двух сезонов. То есть отыграть аркаду персонажем третьего сезона не выйдет, придется лезть в режим выживания, либо в спарринг с ИИ (удачи уделать его на максимальной сложности).
Есть еще глобальный режим Войны Теней, и вот он уже больше напоминает режим истории, но в нем достаточно метагейма с лутбоксами и менеджментом команды бойцов, чтобы мне не хотелось в него пока лезть.

Сетевой код субъективно очень годный, лаги здесь нечастый гость и встретить хоть немного дергающегося оппонента можно раз матчей на 50. А если упомянуть, что есть кроссплей с приставочниками, так все вообще становится просто замечательно - недостатка в соперниках точно не будет.

Вообще, за все мои 38 часов Killer Instinct оставляет самые приятные впечатления, которые не могут испортить даже вырубающийся при использовании оверлея стима геймпад, и кроющие тебя х"ями в микрофон оппоненты. Потому что видно, что серию возрождали с любовью к оригиналу, нежно перенеся и улучшив его боевую систему, отдав дань уважения дизайну персонажей, общей стилистике, и оригинальному музыкальному оформлению. Любой кто играл в оригинальный КИ проронит скупую мужскую слезу от приятной ностальгии, а новые игроки оценят... что-то еще. Я не знаю что оценят новые игроки, им виднее.

Но вот за одну вещь действительно обидно.
Кроссплей в ранкед не завезли. И не завезут. В Винстор версии он есть. Официальная позиция Мелкомягких такова: все игроки стима - потенциальные читеры, и пускать их (нас) в настоящие, устоявшиеся ранкеды они не будут. Одна лидерборда для спорта, другая для нас. Такие дела ребят, для мелкомягких мы второй сорт. И это весьма существенная ложка дегтя как по мне. (За пруфами можно идти на соответствующий раздел реддита).

Мда.

Зато Стим версия значительно дешевле.


PS. Карточек пока нет, но обещают подвезти, потому что они уже нарисованы.

35598742.review:
(Would like to start by stating that this is a review from the perspective of someone who is not exactly into traditional fighting games, this is more in hope of getting other people not into them to get this game)

What's that? You suck at regular one on one fighting games and its hard for you to both focus on doing combos and doing special moves?

[b]GOOD[/b]

Killer instinct has an amazing mechanic that makes it so much more accesible than many similar fighting games, and its automatic combos.

Now, don't you go think its just a "press to win" type of deal, hell no. Lemme explain.

The automatic combo system works as follow, upon mashing light, medium or heavy attack buttons, you automatically perform a combo of this type of attack as if it was a beat-em-up. But what keeps things interesting, is that to initiate combos and break defenses or combos, you still need to go with special inputs and proper timings, thus requiring a certain ammount of skill regardless. 

And veteran players of classic killer instinct titles or fighting games in general will not have to worry as the auto combo system can easily be disabled so they can have much more controls over their combos and inputs.

Gameplay wise, KI is surprisingly fun, welcoming for new players and packed with a shit ton of content for people to play around.

Now that we got out of the way, can we talk about the art and sound design of this game?

Sure, the game does not have netherrealm quality polycount and cinematics, but the game still looks absolutely amazing thanks to its art direction and great characters and backgrounds designs. The sound design makes basic moves feels absolutely brutal to use (so you can imagine how it goes when you do ultra combos and special moves).

And then there's the music. The music alone was part of the reason this game got my attention. Mick Gordon and the crew did an absolutely amazing job with it and it might be imo his best work even out-doing doom 4. Some track might feel a bit underwhelming but trust me there's gonna be one you will want to take this stage for it alone.

So killer instinct the best fighting game ever? Couldn't tell, i don't feel exactly qualified to compare this to other fighting games.
Do i recommend it? Absolutely. This package is an Ultra Combo.

35571995.review:
Eigentlich ein super Spiel. Ich spiele  Killer Instinct seit dem ersten Teil auf dem SNES, später dann Killer Instinct Gold auf dem N64. Ich hoffte, dass mit diesem Release ein lange gehegter Wunsch in Erfüllung geht. Und obwohl ich mich durch Soundtrack, den Kommentator und die vielen Bezüge zu den Original-Teilen in meine Jugend zurück versetzt fühle, bleibt ein sehr bitterer Beigeschmack. Durch die täglichen Missionen und die ständigen Angebote, Dinge wie Skins und Farben mit KI-Gold (welches man mit Echtgeld kaufen kann) schneller zu erwerben, als in der anderen InGame-Währung (Schattenpunkte), sowie das "Anfüttern" mit kleinen, für den Gebrauch viel zu kleinen, Mengen dieser Währungen bleibt ein extremes Free2Play-Feeling. Und für einen Vollpreis-Titel ist das eine absolute Frechheit.

Ansonsten grafisch top, Soundtrack und Kommentator absolut genial, spielerisch genau so geil wie früher.

Fazit: Wer ein geiles Retro-Prügelspiel sucht und darauf verzichten kann, alles ohne den Einsatz von Echtgeld frei zu schalten und gegebenenfalls viel Geld zu investieren, ist hier genau richtig. Komplettisten rate ich (so leid es mir tut) eher ab.

35540738.review:
I am a fan of their original snes version of the game. I used to play this for hours on end and now it comes onto PC. As I get in more hours I'll update it but in the short amount of time I've had to playing this I really am impressed with how well they did and wanted to write a review. I mean I would have just been happy with a clean import of the snes version but this is waaaaay better. 

Here is a quickie of the shell of this. 

Pros: 
-All original characters are free
-There is a freaking battletoad
-Music is the same as it was in the 90s with some tweeks
-I never knew they had a story line, really the last time i saw them was when they were pixalated to hell
-They have a leveling system and somewhat of an RPG element with items you can use within battle. Leveling unlocks skins so it's you earn it or you can buy it with real money. 
-You actually now know wtf was going on in the the first killer instinct
-The animations are beautiful and strong, the movements are fluent plus the characters actually have character dispite the story mode being kinda weird with the frozen models that have clothes flying in the wind still.
-VERY newb friendly, BEST tutorial for anyone new to fighting games I only recommend a controller
-Lots of character Customizations and the option to play a retro version of an original character. 
-Make a shadow of yourself, kill a shadow of yourself, make another shadow of yourself, die to shadow of yourself, be proud of your new born spawn as it rakes in the shadow dough.
-Plenty of characters to learn and have fun with, tons of motivation to play different modes. All the characters have special abilites, special skills and different fighting styles that are very apparent. 


Cons:
-It's not the 90s/80s :( 
-Would recommend a controller (steam controller is not the best for this, xbox is best because of the + pad)
-Unfortunately most of the community seems to be a much higher level of skill so if you are a beginner I would recommend not playing multiplayer
-Orchid is still a pain in the bum
-Shadow Lord, Store and Shadow Lab require internet connection. 

Wishes:
If they made a pixelated time machine or put the original snes version inside of this one :3 or even an all classic mode with everything looking and sounding like it did in the first snes version, I really liked the first one but this one is great!

Last words:

Now as for microtransactions they are completely optional and do not effect the game at this time. You don't even have to buy anything, most of it is just you have to earn it by playing that specific character alot. So far it does have a tinge of grind to it, but it doesn't seem like you have to play the game 800,000 times to get this skin. I can also see this getting popular with competitive play since the style actually negates combos better, and can make a break for turn arounds and such. This is also a very newb friendly game, sure it can get hard very quick if you make it that way. But, it does encourage you to keep going which I don't see in many combat games. 

Updating Review: 10/8
After more hours in the game, there is alot to do and the animation and scenery makes it so it doesn't feel repetitive. I tend to get pumped up when I hear the narrator say ULTRA and his many phrases, so it helps keeps that positive feeling going. The game rewards you for doing everything that it has to offer so task aren't an issue and you will definitely get your 100+ hours out of this. I count 1 dollar = 2 hours, the content would take maybe a few weeks/months to unlock everything unless you are solely devoted to this game then probably a week. 



TL:DR
Best combat game ever. Newb Friendly. You love fighting games? Get this. The price tag is worth it! Battle toad.

35534917.review:
For a fighting game that just came out, this game has a metric ton of content, even if they don't add anything in the future, it fully justifies the $30 base price.
First of all, it's very noob friendly, even if you've never touched a traditional fighting game in your life you'll have a blast. (Honestly last TFG I played over 30 mins. was MK Armageddon over 10 years ago and before that probably MK2 or Killer Instinct at the SNES), but it's deep enough you'll have tons of things to learn and master if you want to go competitive.

Pros:
- Graphics are pretty damn nice.
- 29 characters with pretty unique playstyles, it's hard to get bored with so much variety
- Gameplay is incredibly fluid and fun.
- Very easy to get into, it even has an optional combo-assist system if you struggle with key coordination.
- IT HAS A TUTORIAL SYSTEM THAT IS ACTUALLY GOOD. Actually it's wonderful. You'll learn everything from movement/jumping/comboes to hitboxes/frame data/juggling/other advanced techniques. Many things you'll learn actually translate to other TFG's so it's even a great starting point.
- Crystal-clear Netcode which allows for smooth multiplayer.
- Survival mode and a Shadow mode which records your gamestyle and makes a bot out of it, which you can later challenge or send against the world!
- Combo system is the soul of the game, expect some massive enjoyment out of pulling them off or pulling off that combo-breaker that saves your life!
- Diverse AI difficulty, nothing to complain about it.
- Soundtrack is entertaining as hell, the game even plays its theme in basic tunes while you scroll through a menu!
- Game is very polished.
- While it's far too early to make a proper assesment, fighters seem very balanced even if they're so drastically different.

Middle:
- While it has microtransactions, they honestly may as well be removed from the game and nothing would change, it's only a quicker way to unlock skins/portraits/fluff you'll unlock on your own eventually. I'm not even sure why they put them in in the first place aside from "just because". It displays a huge ! icon everytime you unlock something or start up the game for the first time (removed pressing R on the subscreen), which is pretty distracting TBH.
- Characters has it's own "story mode", basically a small "survival" where you go from one opponent to the next. They have 3 endings each, and that's great and all! But what confuses me is that not every character has their own story, just about 18/29. Also it lacks unique dialogues between fighters or cutscenes or something that makes the feel out of a story mode besides having an intro and an ending.

Cons:
- While characters are memorable, some lack a little extra something to make them really stand out outside of its own world.
- It's quite resource-intensive, I can easily see some computers struggling to run it properly.
- If you can't run it properly, you won't be able to play ranked or public multiplayer (You can still make/join private rooms as far as I've seen).
- Shadow Lords ("Main" story mode) story is BAD, at least the introduction and world-setting. Not even so bad it's funny, just generic and bland, will update if it has a good twist or turn, but doesn't seem likely. It also has a mission-deploy like subgame and consumables which seem oddly out of place, still kudos for trying something new though.
- Some joysticks might be hard to configure without external aid, this is the main thing I hope gets fixed... (I tried with a couple PS2-like generics with no luck... keyboard works amazing for this game but makes it a struggle for local multiplayer)


And honestly that's it, I could rant more about details but honestly you're here for the core experience and a game with polish, passion, and a good value proposition. And it's all there. It baffles me that this game didn't get many news covering it or any advertisements at all... It's definitely worth the try even if you're not into the genre, if you are then I'm sure you'll love it.

35513600.review:
So nice to see this game back 20 years later. Having played the original for SNES with the black cartridge when I was very young, it was very addictive then. 20 Years later, the game is revived for PC with a modern overhaul, and this couldn't be more exciting. For the price, it is totally worth it for anyone that likes KI (was an even better deal on its release promo). The soundtrack is very worth it too. If you are a Mortal Kombat fan, and can give up the gore, this is a better fighter IMO. Actually, [u]I would say this is the best fighter.[/u]

What separates this from MK, aside from the no gore (so it is more friendly in all countries / younger players), is that the gameplay is not overly hard with having to press 8 buttons for a skill, and comboing is very smooth. There is also a combo assistance program for those learning, but I recommend turning it off ASAP in order to properly enjoy the game and raise your skill. It can also get quite difficult on the higher difficulties that will test the elite. There are several elements that add a lot of depth, but never feel overwhelming. Of course you need to practice each character, as there are several "role" styles, such as rusher, tank, etc.


[b][u]What is Killer Instinct Gold that you purchase for real money and is it necessary?[/u][/b]

This is 100% optional, and used to unlock shadow or mimic skins currently. It can also be used in Shadow Lords mode to buy packs, but this only effects your gameplay (unless you do multiplayer shadow lords, but MP shadowlords is designated as a wacky experience, not serious, not to mention it would be a huge waste of cash for people that use these power ups)

In short, it is purely to buy cosmetics or speed through the long-term story mode. You can unlock all this through natural pay too, that is all there is to it, no advantages.

Also, by doing your dailies, you will gradually get small amounts here and here.

[b][u]Some key changes or notes of info:[/u][/b]
-No more humilition finishers or any gorey finishers. Not every character has an ultimate (Orchid really needs one :<), but those as as close to gore as it will get. The sinister nature is implied (setting up daggers beneath the neck, then an offscreen sound effect that implies the head was pushed through them)

-Lots of characters compared to way back - 29 in total.

-Many characters moves are altered, namely in terms of projectiles. I miss Orchid's projectile, and every character used to have one, but now it is select characters only

-Obvious graphics overhaul. They look great really, without being GPU/CPU intensive [b](Note: for online ranked, your PC MUST pass a inspection and score 1000 - I scored 1006 with a GTX 960 2GB & I5 3570k. Not sure how high the score scales, but I assume the numbers don't go far above 1000)[/b]

-Combo Breakers are unlimited now, but you only have 1 chance per combo set to get it right

[b][u]Single Player:[/u][/b]

There is a lot going on for single player in relation to a fighting game. Unless you buy your way through, or absolutely dislike Shadow Lords mode, this will keep you busy for a quite some time.

-Regular story mode: Fight through a roster and perform specific accomplishments to unlock canvas pieces. This is a long term goal where you complete 10 characters worth about, x2 seasons

-Survival mode: Survive with one character through as many fights as possible
--Shadow Survival mode: Same as survival, but with shadow players (harder clones of real people in a sense)

-Dojo: This is where you practice and learn all the elements of the game.

-Shadow Lords Mode: This is the main story/SP element. You fight, make story choices, gain items/power-ups, with the ultimate goal being to take down the shadow lord. This will require a lot of time investment, but your items and stuff carry over to the next playthrough. This makes it a nice progression system without losing your time invested

-Dailys: Several dailys, resetting each day, that give you rewards for Shadow Lord mode & general player exp

[b][u]Multiplayer:[/u][/b]

I have not really touched this mode, as the SP modes are super fun. I tried fighting a friend though, and even while downloading near my bandwidth limit, the fight worked flawlessly. Usually when I download like this, there is noticeable lag, so that in itself speaks something

-You got ranked / standard playmodes

-There is also a Shadow Lords multiplayer, but it is a non serious mode as people can use their power ups, making for a one sided match. There are dailies tied to this though (the biggest being play 5 matches, win or lose) so you got nothing to lose


[b][u]Characters:[/u][/b]

For the most part, each character feels unique, but they do fit into one of several roles, which determines their playstyle. Rushers for example are fast and combo focused fighters, but they deal less damage in exchange. Tanks take blows like champs, but are slower of course and hit harder. There are more categories, and some are unique such as using their own health to fight, but having the ability to siphon it back. In total you have 29 characters, and it comes down to finding what fits you, then having fun practicing the rest and trying to get good as them as well.

Several characters use or share button skillsets, so it isn't overly complex. Each has their own set, but many use a Down - Bottom Right - Right - Attack - as a single for example.


[b][u]Fighting:[/u][/b]

The fighting is satisfying. It is not difficult, the combo system is smooth, but there is enough depth and complexity to go at it from many ways. There is a slight limitation in how it is set up. You want to perform combo openers > auto > linkers > auto > linkers > ender, or something like that. Doing this is what lets you effectively chunk the most health for your efforts. Other methods work too, but for less damage.

-Shadow skills are a nice touch, as they are simply a stronger, more lethal version of your key combo skills.

-Winning the fight and performing that Ultra finisher is really fun and never gets old. Alternatively you can convert it into a stage ultra if possible, or an ultimate finisher if the character has one.

-Combo breakers: A fighting chance to break out of a combo, if you can read the enemy hit set right (High, Medium, Low). This is a fun system, and unlike past KI's, it is unlimited, but you only have 1 chance to break out per combo set the enemy performs.

[b][u]Unlockables:[/u][/b]

Mimic & Shadow Skins, + a stage or two. You can earn all this through regular play or buy it with KI gold. There is also all the achievement, progression, and performance side stuff like lore, alternate costume colors, and so on. Most of this is tied to simply playing the game and leveling up the characters.


[b][u]Scoring:[/u][/b]

Personal experience score: 10/10

Story: -/10 - Hard to rate this, but Shadow Lords offers a form of story, along with lore for each character, and some general story to them. It is a fighter so it isn't the main focus, but there is a bunch of it. 

Sound: 10/10 - KI has always had one of the best soundtracks out there since its SNES edition, Seasons 1-3 just made it even better.

Graphics: 10/10 - Excellent. Runs perfect on GTX 960 and it looks perfect, without sacrificing any performance

Controls: 9/10 - Easy to use on my 360 controller. I find using a control stick a bit harder and the Dpads on these aren't so great, so if you can use something with a pad or joystick (like SNES controller or an arcade controller), that is your best bet. The controls are easy regardless though, you just have to learn the few pattern styles consisting of 2-4 buttons, and many characters use similar combinations.

Game Length: 10/10 - The play is infinite, ultimately. The longevity of the game will be user based. If you are looking to play an hour or 2 here or there, willing to learn and get good at playing characters outside your comfort zone, if you are going to multiplayer, etc.

35510131.review:
I just wanna get this outta the way immediately: I'm getting a refund for this game because unfortunately it doesn't run properly on my LAPTOP (I expected it, it no way detracts from my love for this game. Just means I have to play it on XBone)

Those who play street fighter, uMVC3 or Tekken may find this game to be simple on the technical side of things, that's because this game puts an emphasis on adapting to an opponent's patterns, since the combo pattern is relatively straightforward. (Opener -> Auto Double/Manual -> linker  -> ender. Steps two and three can be repeated until the KV (Knockdown Value) reaches 100, at which point the character being hit will spin out and the combo will end without being able to end it. Keep in mind that you can end the combo if the last hit before the ender pushes the KV meter above 100.

The complexity of this game comes from, as I said, the adaptations that players make during matches. I'm not going to go into detail with just HOW complex it is, because that'd make this review longer than it needs to be, but tl;dr if you're quick to adapt, you will excel at this game. Punishing an opponent's mistake is very satisfying as every combo can potentially do 30%+ damage, depending on how you do it. 

But, alongside the layers upon layers of guessing, adapting and predicting what your opponent is going to do, further complexity is given through the mechanic of combo traits. These are character-specific traits which aid them in some way. For example, I'm a Sadira main. Sadira's combo trait is air juggle,  she is the first character in the series to have a proper air combo system, and you can have some really fancy comboes that start on the ground and end in the air. 

ON TOP of combo traits, there's also a mechanic specific to this game that adds a way to extend comboes: Instinct mode. When you activate instinct mode mid-combo, it resets the KV meter I spoke about before, while keeping your ender level the same. Not only does it reset the combo, allowing you to essentially double the damage, but it gives your character MORE traits that help them. Again, take Sadira as an example. Her instinct mode gives her access to web traps, which allow you to place a static, area-controlling web in front of her. This has a myriad of uses: making combo breaker attempts safe, anti-airing, extra damage/hitstun, just to name a few. It really has Sub-Zero ice clone vibes. Not only that, but during her instinct mode, she also gains the ability to jump-cancel her normals. This leads to, assuming you're in a combo, A LOT of damage, as you can link a heavy kick into itself for massive damage. But your opponent has the choice of whether or not to break it, or predict that you're going to throw an occasional light kick in to try and block them out from counter breakers. Or you could take a chance and throw out a counter breaker to reset the combo AGAIN.

That's what this game is about. Risk vs reward: knowing when to take a risk, when not to take one, and even by not taking a risk, you're taking one, if that makes any sense. 

I haven't even brought up one-player modes. As with every fighting game I've played, the AI on very hard/maximum difficulty feels cheap, especially in this game where breaking a combo all depends on if you adapt and choose the right attack strength to break against. The AI has an "Ultimate" difficulty, also known as Kyle, I'm assuming a programmer who developed the game. It's unbeatable, I gave it two tries and stopped because it wasn't fun. It gives off classic Mortal Kombat vibes, where you have to cheap the game out with safe moves and conform to a playstyle that you don't necessarily want to use and don't have fun with. That being said, medium/hard difficulty is fun. 

Shadow lords is a refreshing amalgamation of RPG elements combined with the core game to make a less serious but still really fun game mode. Upon first glance you may think "WOW, that enemy has 50% extra health? That's BULL." But you'll soon realise that you, too, have the opportunity to buff your character's stats through the use of consumable items and guardians. Consumables range from using them before the match to give your character full instinct/shadow meter, healing the character (because health carries over after a match if you win, if you lose, that character dies but can be resurrected if you have the item for it) to dealing more/taking less damage in the match. Guardians give passive boosts to your stats (Trust me, if you want to unlock the astral plane stage by beating Gargos on challenging difficulty, you're going to NEED the stat boosts) but they also give an active effect that you need to charge the guardian to use. You charge the guardian with astral energy that you gain by playing the game mode. I mentioned unlocking the Astral Plane as a stage because it shows that, even though there's microtransactions in the game, that stage cannot be unlocked by paying for it. You can accelerate its unlocking by paying for KI gold to buy strong guardians, but it isn't paywalled: you can earn those guardians by playing the game, and I did, I didn't spend anything on it. It just took longer.

As for online: I don't know, I haven't played it on PC so I can't judge the netcode, I live in Australia so the connections to other players on a good day would be average at best, and I haven't played it online on the XBone.

Now for the tl;dr pros&cons:

Pros:
Every character feels fresh and unique, and aren't typical/stereotypical (Jago isn't a Japanese Ninja or black belt, he's a Tibetan Monk, how many fighting games have such an unorthodox character/personality?)
Combo system is relatively simple and easy to grasp; friendly/welcoming to new players, easy to master and excel at
Looks great.
AWESOME guest characters from other Rareware/xbox games (Rash, Arbiter, General Raam). 
AWESOME music. DYNAMIC music, aka the music changes depending on what's happening in the match, never seen it before.
FULL transparency of moves (frame data, other info on moves such as invincibility, frame advantage on block, etc. For people like me who want to know their character inside out, this is GREAT.)
Despite the simple combo system, the game still has footsies, spacing, etc.
You earn extra colours/cosmetics while playing the character and levelling them up, giving more incentive to play the character.
Tier lists aren't as conclusive in other games. While Fulgore is REALLY good, characters are really well balanced.
Lots of characters.

Cons
While the combo system is fun, comboes can start to feel stale after doing them so many times, even if you mix up attack strengths.
Microtransactions: You can buy all colours except for the level 50 colour, letting you buy the colour you want and not bothering with the rest, devaluing the whole "earn it through gameplay" system.
Microtransactions : You can buy guardians and healing items in Shadow lords, which (for me) devalues unlocking the astral plane as a stage.
AI can feel cheap, as with every fighting game, and inhuman in reaction times.
Microtransactions: Just because they're a trend in games nowadays doesn't mean I have to like them. 

In summary: If you're a fighting game fan, give it a try. Do I recommend it? YES. It's such a fun game.

35494078.review:
杀手本能，由于我没有玩过其他平台所以就PC平台而论，
这是一款相当棒的格斗游戏了。
对我而言，一款是否合格的格斗游戏在拥有完整的游戏制度下主要看2点，
手感流畅度和操作的平衡性，其次，画面的炫酷，音效的打击感，人设与动作设计等等，当然这款游戏都做到了。
手感上非常的舒服，横版式移动就算在PC上，不用手柄上手也不会觉得很头痛，这一点我觉得没有问题。
操作上跟众多新的格斗游戏一样，比较平衡（当然完全平衡太难了）。[u] 连招的连击与技能的衔接很棒，有些连招可以激活地图特殊技，当然加大了操作的难度。	[/u]
这一点也构成了游戏的基本框架，那么就来说说加分的项目。

画面：游戏中的画面多变，每个地图的细节之多，从远古战场、科幻世界、唐人街等等，背景都是经过严格处理过，并且人物的技能也能与背景互动，做的细节之多，看的出制作团队非常用心。可以说背景是具有一定的观赏性的配合人物技能的华丽程度，但是整体上画面是给人一种很融洽的感觉。如果要求严格来说，就是虚拟引擎差了一点，有些画面不细致。相对于100+的游戏来说，这画面也是能接受的。

打开游戏的进场音乐就是节奏摇滚乐，然后打斗音乐也十分带感，技能的特效音。都没有给这款游戏拖后腿。

游戏性：剧情上，基本上没有值得注意的剧情。很是生硬的剧情，但是很有意思的是，游戏中角色众多，每个人都有一个独立的小短片，短片中的是人物格斗的特性和人设的建立。开发者想的很周到，把每个角色的各个方面都考虑进去了。关于你的后宫换装系列，完全不亚于拳皇。在角色中我可以看到游戏中的众多角色我都感觉似乎在哪里见过.....（分别类似有咒怨，妖刀姬，铁血战士，恐龙战队中的某一角色），并且每个人需要的战斗机制不一样，减少了许多的格斗游戏的弊端，就是重复性，有为了捡刀的，有为了增加怒气的.......让人玩的可玩性大大的增高。

联机系统暂时没有多少人。我看我的好友里面有这款游戏的就只有2个。算是比较小众的良心游戏。

抛开剧情来说单机的乐趣能够满足大多数人的口味。当然喜欢猎奇的也会喜欢剧情，因为脑洞太大了。



看了近两年的大厂的格斗游戏，虽然都不错贵但是很多可玩性还不如这款游戏。例如：XXXX7（又称吃老本7），XXXXXVSXXXXX，（我都不想说了）。都是好游戏所以我想说的是



                                           [h1] 我只能给这款游戏打一个大大的好评。	[/h1]

35493954.review:
Ребята данный файтинг - это сказка!  Я переиграл во все лучшие файтинги на ПК: МК (3-и ласт серии), стрит файтер (2-е ласт серии), инжастис 1 - всё это не долго захватывало. 
Но вот Killer Instinct 2017 - это реально кайфовый файтинг.

КРАТКО ПЕРЕЧИСЛЮ ПЛЮСЫ ИГРЫ:
1. Графон отменный, красивые эффекты.
2. Тонкие настройки игры,  есть доп. пакет музыки.
3. Лёгкие и красивые Комбухи + СпецУдары.
4. Полно квестов и крафтов для создания вещей.
5. Бойцов можно переодевать в разные крутые шмотки.
6. Ежедневные задания и награды за них.
7. Отличный оптимизированный Онлайн для битв.
8. Есть моя любимая жаба RASH, но это не всем понять!
9. После 30 часов игры, я смог выносить Серебряных соперников с 50 уровнем.
10. Игра не требует супер ПК, кайфую на ультра конфиге ниже 60 ФПС никогда не проседает (развёртка экрана 1920х1080).
11. Полно разных скинов, фонов, значков для профиля и героев.
12. Есть почти 500 достижений для Стима.
12. Игра не имеет долгих и нудных загрузок, темп боёв очень быстрый.
13. Донат в этой игре нафиг не нужен абсолютно любую ПЛЮШКУ можно заработать потом!

Конкуренты данного файтинга тоже есть: INJUSTICE 2,  TEKKEN 7,   MK XL

МЕЛКИЕ МИНУСЫ тоже нашёл, после 260 часов игры:
1. Не у всех героев есть Ультимэйты
2. Жаль,  что лишь Gargos имеет серебряный скин, для всех они нужны!
3. Не у всех героев есть Шмотки, хотелось бы больше шмоток для всех!

35481011.review:
Крайне уникальный файтинг с очень интересной системой боя.

Комбо механика:
- сделанна по принципу конструктора, разобравшись в ней один раз вы сможете делать комбо за любого персонажа, просто посмотрев его приемы в мув листе.
Из этого вытекает очень жирный плюс - вам не придется сидеть день и ночь в Practice Room и тренировать комбинации 24/7.
Кому то может показаться такая система слишком легкой, но истиная сложность кроется в Майнд-гейме, со своим противником.

Персонажи:
-они по истине уникальны, разработчики брали идеи откуда только можно, как вам например двухглавый Троль который меняет стиль боя в зависимости от того какая голова спит а какая бодрствует (привет Warcraft), и меняться они между собой могут случайно прям во время комб, вам же придется подстравиваться ну или ударить себя по голове, может и поможет. =)

Робот который имеет 3 присоединяемых модуля, каждый со своей шкалой НР вы можете менять модули дополняя свой арсенал новыми приемами переключая паралельно и свою шкалу жизни. (Напоминает смену персонажей в Marvel vs Capcom) 

Мира, девшка вампир обладающая мощнейшим арсеналом мувов и воздушными дешами (здравствуй Guilty Gear) но за которые приходиться расплачиваться своими жизнями, которые можно пополнить высасывая кровь соперника.

Про Жабу я думаю уже всё сказали и без меня, его сделали с большой любовью к серии BatleToats.

Донат:
-многие умники отыграв по 20 минут кричат что в игре система доната душит и т.д. но зайдя в галерею вы обнаружите что у вас уже открыты все персонажи все доп костюмы к ним, все ультры, и покупать вам практически нечего, кроме тех косметических предметов которые открываются по прокачке персонажей или аккаунта, и это здорово мы же хотим какую то награду за то что прокачали своего мейна? или будем донить чтобы открыть все что потом и так само откроется?

Минусы:
-к минусам можно отнести малое количество народу, в виду того что уж слишком долго она была эксклюзивом на Х-Боксе и Winows 10.
-а так же отсутствие кроссплея в ранкеде.

35477910.review:
TL;DR BUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYITBUYI-

Killer Instinct is a fucking masterpiece, ok!?

This review shouldn't exist, every child that is born should automatically have their parents pay the money to buy them Killer Instinct on any platform and not doing it should lead into a death sentence, people who don't like it need to be eradicated from existance and have their ashes removed from the mortal plane, people who are indifferent need mental rehabilitation, this is THE greatest fucking fighting game of all time and nothing is gonna convince me otherwise.

The story is interesting and unique, and kinda long, so I'm not gonna explain it here, look into it though, it's killer stuff, just like the rest of the game.

The presentation is KILLER, the graphics look amazing, the characters look fucking stylish as hell, their designs and animations all look awesome, and speaking of characters, this game has a monstrous mash of characters, a ninja monk warrior guy, a soldier rebel resistance lady, werewolves, aliens, skeletons, robots, archers, vampires, golems, dinosaurs, FUCKING BATTLETOADS, it's AWESOME, you have a fuckton of them, too, all of them looking very different and unique to themselves, some maybe sharing traits from eachother, but never the same, the music is excellent, composed by Mick Gordon, Atlas Plug and Celldweller, just the fuckin' greatest music I've ever heard in any game ever, trust me, I'm not lying, plus, if you're worried about not being able to run the game, don't worry, it's EXTREMELY optimized, by turning the graphics down a lil' bit, and lowering the resolution, even my shitty built-in AMD Radeon R5 1GB graphics card and AMD A6-7400K managed to run it, WITH ANTI-ALIASING, AMBIENT OCCLUSION, BLOOM AND HIGH-QUALITY TEXTURES, THIS GAME WILL RUN.

Aaand.

The most important thing, the gameplay, is supreme.

If you can't get into fighting games, this is the place to start, accessible, and yet, deep, the combo system makes this game very fun, for both people who want to grab a couple of drinks, sit down and turn their brains off, or for people who want to get good and learn how to actually play fighting games, this game is MADE for everyone, essentially, you use a special move or jump attack to start a combo, from there, it's up to you, you can do auto-doubles of any strength, each with different speeds, light being fast and weak, medium being medium, heavy being slow but damaging, pressing the kick and punch buttons give you different animations for those which is important for somethin' I'll explain soon,  and then, you have linkers of varying strengths, light hits once, medium hits twice, heavy hits thrice, now you might be thinking "Ok, why does their speeds and looks matter?", simple, my beautiful friend: Combo breakers, you need to make your combo look confusing to the opponent so they won't break it, light linkers and auto-doubles are fast, hard to predict and see, hard to break, medium is a little bit less hard, but deals more damage and so on, after that, you can end your combo with an ender, each ender doing different things, some enders give you more meter, others deal a lot of damage, some allow you to juggle the opponent, some are character-specific and do special things, it's amazing!

Now, you might be having another thought "Well, so if the opponent can break my combo, should I even do them?" Yes, my friend, you should, because, by baiting your opponent into breaking your combo, or guessing they will try to break it, you can unleash a counter-breaker, and continue combo-ing them to oblivion as they watch helplessly from a lockout, the mindgames are unleashed, and it becomes very fun!

But maybe you don't care about that, maybe you're not really caring about fighting games, maybe you like strategy?

Aye, Shadow Lords exists, an entire single-player rogue-like campaign where you manage a team of three characters and deploy them to specific locations, in attempts to hold-out against Gargos' arrival, managing what opponents they fight and what actions they take, picking battles and equipping them with items against an onslaught of powerful mimics and Omens, while still maintaining itself with that fighting game gameplay in action, it becomes fun to even people who aren't interested in fighting games!

In general, this game is literally perfect in every way to me, maybe I'm just biased for loving KI since my childhood, it's what made me get into fighting games, and as such, I have sold out my soul to Iron Galaxy and Double Helix, they have created the second coming of fighting game christ after KI1 and 2, BUY IT, SPEND MONEY ON IT, FUCK YOUR REBEL/DINOSAUR/GHOST/ROBOT/NUNCHUCK MARTIAL ARTIST WIFE AND PRAISE BE TO GARGOS!

35471541.review:
J'aime pas trop les jeux de baston en général (surtout car beaucoup de jeu de combat sont hyper japonisé, par exemple street of fighter et king of fighter ça me donne des nausées tellement c'est manga/japon (même si j'aime les mangas, c'est way too much à ce niveau.) mais Killer Instinct et Mortal Kombat sont pour moi deux exceptions, l'univers est bien plus sombre qu'un street fighter et les personnages ont beaucoup plus de charisme qu'un judoka ou un catcheur en slip, on peut pas comparer Thunder (Qui a une superbe ost.) à T.Hawk ou TJ Combo à Balrog vu l'écart niveau charisme ça serait pas fair-play.

En plus de ça les musiques sont hyper sympa (écoute l'OST de TJ COMBO, ORCHID ou THUNDER et comparez ça à l'ost de street fighter qui est presque le même, "si encore les musiques étaient sympa...."depuis plus de 20 ans.) on se sent vraiment dans le truc, c'est pas simplement un jeu où tu diriges des persos random ou péter pour win.
Les personnages ont leurs propres musiques et sont hyper attachant, perso je joue les personnages que j'aime pour ce qu'ils sont car chaque perso est vraiment unique, pas car ils sont peté (De toute façon sur SF les persos ça serait des stickman avec le même skin ça serait pareil.)

Il y a un gros tuto hyper sympa et plein de contenu singleplayer si vous avez peur de vous prendre des gifles en ligne. (Le peu de joueur que j'ai croisé en ligne était super sympa, il y a même un américain qui a parlé tout seul pendant 1h le temps qu'on joue c'était plutôt drôle)

Comparé à Mortal Kombat (Déso MK, même si je t'aime beaucoup) qui est devenu vraiment nase au fil du temps, Killer Instinct est toujours aussi fun qu'avant. (voir peut-être plus?)

Le seul petit point négatif que je peux donner à ce jeu... si vous avez joué aux anciens KI je trouve que quelques (pas beaucoup) anciens persos ont perdu de la gueule... Enfin de tête il y en a que deux, Glacius qui est devenu une... crotte de nez de glace il est immonde et son OST est pas top et Sabrewulf qui est devenu un petit chien gringalet alors qu'avant c'était un loup imposant et qui faisait peur.

Sinon à part ça je recommande à 200% pour ceux qui veulent un jeu de combat accessible et hyper fun qui change de la soupe habituelle japonisé avec toujours les mêmes véterants dessus

(en plus Riptor est très mignonne en chearleader)

As a kid I remember the first time I opened my brand new Killer Instinct and I was like WHOA, THE CARTRIDGE IS *BLACK*? THAT'S HARDCORE!

I bought this game two days ago and while it was installing I experienced the same eagerness as I was practically bouncing in my seat waiting for the game to install so I could jump in and play it and let me tell you...I was NOT disappointed.

The graphics are updated but all those beloved characters still look the same because they included the retro looks! Not just that, there's TONS of new characters...Including a Battle Toad! A frikkin' battle toad.

So for fans of the old, fans of the new and fans of fighting games in general I recommend it. It's got mechanics that make it accessible to both casual fighter fans and more hardcore fighter fanatics with the ability to disable and enable the easy combo styles and a lot of modern day fighting conventions such as wall bouncing and juggling. The graphics are amazing and there are enough characters to satisfy almost any style of play.

35455443.review: Premesso che ho giocato ampiamente la versione su Windows Store uscita nel 2016, Microsoft e Iron Galaxy sfruttano all'osso Killer Instinct sdoganandolo definitivamente su PC via Steam, con supporto a partitre da Windows 7 (pur con qualche problema lamentano alcuni utenti) anzichè solo il 10. Se ne va anche il modello F2P dove si compra a blocchi (stagioni) o solo i lottatori preferiti, per un più sensato pack completo limitando le transazioni in-app a puri elementi estetici (sbloccabili comunque con la moneta ingame accumulabile o acquistandola con denaro reale). Il mio parere su questo KI è orientato al sì, pur rimanendo un gioco sviluppato per XOne nel 2013, migliorato nel tempo ma pur sempre indietro nei parametri qualitativi. Sì per il crossplay con boxari e PCisti fedeli al programma play anywhere di Microsoft anche se oltre l'Exhibition, la Lobby e la modalità Shadow Lords non si va, leggete niente match classificati. Sì per la caterva di obiettivi (oltre 400) ed elementi sbloccabili per personalizzare di tutto, sì al miglior tutorial di sempre e al gameplay granitico ed estremo che abbiamo apprezzato ai tempi del primo su N64/Arcade. Sì perchè si preme ad minchiam tasti su tasti e viene sempre fuori della roba spettacolare trasportata dalla colonna sonora tra le migliori di sempre per un fighting game. Ma ricordatevi che state giocando a un titolo del 2013 che oramai ha dato tutto, non possiamo sapere quanta gente ci sta ancora sulle piattaforme Microsoft ma su Steam http://steamcharts.com/app/577940 siamo nell'ordine delle poche centinaia di giocatori. Una community praticamente morta. La porzione single player saprà intrattenervi a lungo in particolare la Shadow Lords sembra un X-Com in miniatura e l'AI che impara in base al vostro stile (una chicca), insomma in locale fuori discussione, ma se puntate all'online farei molta attenzione. Per il prezzo proposto si ha comunque un rapporto qualità e materiale offerto davvero invidiabile. Peccato quei 48gb di spazio mangiati post installazione, a mio avviso inspiegabili. Fight On!

35454688.review:
Dire que j'ai une très grande affection pour la franchise KI serait un euphémisme. 
Ce jeu m'a couté un investissement incroyable quand on a 10 ans : des manettes de Super Nes qui rendent l'âme qu'il faut remplacer, des pièces de 10 balles dans la borne d'arcade à en violer ma tirelire et des ampoules au pouce gauche à répétition.
Cette franchise est celle qui m'a donné le gout des jeux de baston. Rien que ça.

Autant donc vous dire qu'en le voyant passer sur Steam, je n'ai même pas réfléchi au fait de l'acheter. 
Redevenir un gosse de 10 ans et avoir une carte bleue, ça ne se maitrise pas (et ça vous est déjà arrivé j'en suis sûr).

Après, il a des choses avec lesquelles je ne suis pas d'accord, notamment, la simplification du système de combo (qui peut se désactiver en effet), la disparition des Humiliation et des Danger Moves (ok, il y a un Utlimate par perso, mais bon...), la disparition des séquences animées de victoire (Supreeeeeme victory !) et surtout, cette putaindebordeldemerdedesaloperie de boutique en ligne à la con. 
Mais au moins, le jeu est complet dans cette version Steam. Pour le moment...

Pour le reste, le jeu est pas trop moche à mon gout, fluide, stable, méga vif (faut pas cligner des yeux des fois !) et pour ma part, la bande son m'a fait mouiller mon slip.

Si vous aimez les vieux KI, vous y trouverez ici un bon successeur et plein de clins d'oeil.
A noter que je trouve cette version très respectueuse du matériel d'origine.

Si vous ne connaissez pas la franchise, venez tâter ce qu'est un vrai jeu à combo ! 
Le didacticiel est complet et vous en apprendra les rouages.
Et ça vous changera des licences méga connues.

Un bon jeu à n'en pas douter !

35450819.review:
Увидел игру, посмотрел по заставкам, снимкам экрана... Ну, подумал: Куплю хотя-бы изза музыки. 
Купил, поиграл... Понял, что игра простая. Ох, как-же я тогда ошибался...
Ну, с "комбо-помошником" играть действительно просто: жми себе стрелку и пару кнопок, и твой персонаж такие финты выдаёт - голливудские актёры обзавидуются! На "новичке" чувствуешь себя прямо-таки папкой-нагибатором каким-то!
Затем, спустя какое-то время зашёл и поиграл на среднем уровне сложности. Ничего, тоже всё довольно легко. Персонажи противника просто "сминаются" постоянными комбо-связками....
... А потом меня угораздило записать двойника, и пойти в режим выживания.
... А после я ещё и в сюжет-режим "Владыки теней" зашёл. И попал на несколько теневых миссий высокой сложности.
И потом я понял вот что:
1. Я вообще ничего в этой игре не умею, кроме как жать пару-тройку кнопок.
2. У меня не получается пользоваться ни прерывателями комбо, ни блоками. Причина в том, что управление на клавиатуре для меня не удобно.
3. Так или иначе - мне нужно приобретать джойстик. Может хоть тогда научусь нормально играть.

В целом - в игре почти нет минусов. А если и есть, то связаны они с личными проблемами конкретного человека. Т.е. индивидуальны. Один игрок будет их видеть, они будут для него минусами, а другой - нет. Вот так же и со мной.

В общем эта та игра, которая показала мне что я, как говорится, "не смог в файтинги". (когда-то в юношестве на соньке первой в теккен 3 нормально получалось. Старею.) 
Плюсов в игре много: начиная от интересной, зрелищной боёвки и кастомизации персонажей, заканчивая хорошим сюжетом и отсутствием надобности в донате. Перечислять не буду, ибо сами увидите, поиграв в неё.
А поиграть определённо стоит!

35427901.review:
[h1]C-C-C-C-C-COMBO BREAKER!!![/h1]

Именно с оригинальной игры Killer Instinct (1994) появился данный "мем". Именно по этой игре и проводился самый первый игровой турнир в России, но знают ли все эту игру? Нет. Все знают Mortal Kombat, Street Fighter, Tekken, которые на протяжении стольких лет выпускали новые части, а вот KI оставалась в тени после второй части (1996) и не получала никаких сиквелов и развитии. Microsoft Studios, однако, решила, что к выпуску Xbox One неплохо вернуть этот файтинг обратно. И задача была выполнена.

Первоначально, проект был Free-2-Play (знакомые элементы которой присутствуют и в Steam-версии), вы сразу могли скачать игру, но на старте доступно было лишь пару бойцов, остальных извольте покупать за реальные деньги. Ростер был тогда не слишком богатым, но прошло Три Сезона в игре, за это время она позже вышла на ПК и ранее, но только на Windows 10 и только в Windows Store за 2000 рублей. И вот в конце сентября 2017 года, Killer Instinct (2013) выходит в Steam, да не просто в Steam, но и с возможностью поиграть на Windows 7 - всего за 700 рублей. За одну плату вы получите абсолютно всех персонажей и полный доступ ко всем функциям (но не к скинам).

Особенность данного файтинга от конкурентов в том, что он проще, но в то же время динамичнее. Всё строится на комбо. Если в MK, Tekken, SF вам необходимо было для успешного комбо заучивать движения и нажатия, чтобы красиво влепить оппоненту, то здесь вы можете нажимать на любые кнопки в любом порядке - вы очень просто сможете сделать комбо аж до 35 ударов, а потом завершить её красивой серии ударов, получив GODLIKE COMBO! Но KI не был бы KI без того самого брейкера. Противник может полностью прервать ваше комбо и ударить в ответ, если отобьёт следующий ваш удар, угадав, какой он (быстрый, средний, сильный), а потом раздастся эпический заикающийся голос C-C-C-C-C-C-C-COMBO BREAKER!!! Но в ответ можно произвести C-C-C-C-C-COUNTER BREAKER!!!, дабы продолжить комбо и отразить Брейкер. Здесь нет раундов, у каждого игрока по две шкалы здоровья (как в том же Injustice: God Amoung Us и 2) и при обнулении одной, будет короткий перерыв после нокаута. А чтобы красиво завершить матч, вы можете совершить УЛЬТРАААААА-КОМБООООООО!!!!!, которые выполнены здесь очень просто и зрелищно, ну или же совершить ULTIMATE, аналог знаменитых Fatality из MK.

А ростер бойцов здесь и вправду разнообразный. И разнообразный не толкьо в плане "цветных ниндзя". Каждый боец обладает своими спец.приёмами и порой своим стилем ведения боя. Так ФулГор накапливает Теневую шкалу автоматически при помощи Реактора, атаки слегка медленные, но тяжёлые. Мира является вампиром и она может использовать свои спец.приёмы тратя своё здоровье, но после этого она может выпить кровушки из врага (но не более того, насколько она сама истратила это), робот Ария обладает тремя телами, имеющие собственные шкалы здоровья, которые можно менять местами. Мне не надо говорить про боевую жабу Раша и Арбитра из Halo?

Бонусом здесь есть даже полноценная кампания, выполненная в виде набора миссии, которые появляются каждый ход. Целью кампании является подготовка к прибытию некого Горгоса, могучего демона, который хочет уничтожить Землю. Три выбранных в начале бойца идут сражаться с "мимиками", теневыми клонами бойцов ростера. Как и полагается для F2P игр, тут есть донат (!!!), наборы со случайными предметами, премиум-валюта, крафтинг вещей и прочее. Конечно, это не полноценная стратегия, но хоть что-то. И помните. Микротранзакции здесь только к премиум-валюте, которая позволяет раньше времени приобрести скины, наборы карточек, вещей и прочей мелких вещей. ПРи покупке игры вы УЖЕ платите за все функции и ничего дополнительно открывать не надо.

Графика вполне себе приличная и приятная, не особо требовательная, игра же 2013 года. Саундтрек идеален, тяжёлая музыка Майка Гордона делает своё дело. А вот чего может не понравится игрокам, так это локализация. ИМХО, у меня нет притензии к переводу меню, но субтитры речи персонажей иногда некорекктно переведены, а порой и вовсе нет. Имена персонажей остаются на английском, к счастью (для меня). Но благо можно переключиться на английский.

9.5 ULTRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAААААААААААААААААААААААА эпического комментатора из 10

35426086.review:
A very easy recommendation for anyone even slightly interested in fighting games.

[b]Pros[/b]:
+ One of the best ways to enter the fighting game genre as it has the most extensive tutorial I've ever seen, combined with an amazing AI system in the form of the "Shadow Lab", a system that makes a shadow version of yourself for you to practice against and send out to other players playing Shadow Survival. (think Sm4sh Amiibo's but online sharing compatable and extremely good at actually mimicing the actual player).
You can literally play against "yourself", punish your own mistakes and then have that same AI in the next round use the new punish you just found against you, which creates this infinite cycle of "getting gud". (also, I aint gonna lie, the fact you can see how your AI ruined someone's survival streak is amazing as you get a fully high detailed replay of it)

+ Varied and big roster, while most characters share the same input style (quarter circle + punch/kick motions) the way they end up fighting differs greatly: from the close range rushdown god that is Sabrewulf to the frustrating keepaway of Glacius to the straight up terrifying grappling of General Raam, it's all here.

+ Dynamic Music by Mick Gordon, the same guy that made the Doom soundtrack and it's just as amazing here.
If you need a good sample of what's ingame, personal recommendations would be Hinnamatoom, Inferno and I'm Back (to Rise), Thunder, Cinder and TJ Combo's themes respectively.

+ Amazing Netcode, and a reletively healthy playerbase thanks to crossplay.

+ Unique combo and combo breaking system, the definition of "easy to learn, hard to master"


[b]Cons[/b]:
- Unskippable win animations, no biggie in online but when running arcade or survival this gets repetetive fast, especially on characters with a lengthy win animation

- If you plan on playing a character that's not from the season 1 or 2 roster you won't be having an arcade mode, this is replaced with a "Shadow Lords" mode (which season 1 and 2 characters can also play), Shadow Lords is nice but the missing arcade mode for these characters is a bit odd

- Ranked mode does not have crossplay enabled for one reason or another.

- The free to play version is still being held hostage by Microsoft, which is a real shame considering how great it is at teaching how to play the genre as a whole.

No more Windows store / 10

35423742.review:
I've put in several hundred hours into the Xbox One / Windows 10 version of KI, so ignore the finite Steam version in-game time.

Killer Instinct is one of the best fighting games of this generation. Season 3 overhauled the combo system, and Iron Galaxy has been relentless with well thought-out balance changes. They really listen to the community, and they love the game which is evident in each character design. The passion they pour into the game is immense.

It has the best netcode of any fighting game, and the community is strong and active throughout.

The Dojo (in-game tutorial) teaches you all of the mechanics in a meaningful way (great to learn about fighting games in general), and has hands down the best online resource available (ki.infil.net) for any game ever (easy reading, thorough explanations, tooltips, and gifs galore).

The combo system is an anchor of familiarity which allows you to more easily pick up a new character and explore various play styles. For example, I play Jago, Sabrewulf, Glacius, Arbiter, Sadira, TJ Combo, Omen, Riptor, Hisako, and Fulgore. Note the system can be as complex as you want to make it, allows for an additional layer of decision making, and supports a scope of what I like to call "calm" execution. It should not be scoffed at, and in my mind, deserves much praise.

Give this game an honest try, and I promise you won't be disappointed. Fight on!

35419262.review:
This is the fighting game that you give to a friend who doesn't play fighting games to learn, the Steam Edition of Killer Instinct comes with all of the characters as well as the extra premium skins that were added into the game. Killer Instinct has arguably one of the best tutorial systems that I have played with in recent years, if not one of the best period. It allows you to learn at a reasonable pace each and every one of the specific features of the game, including assists so that people are able to learn what combo breaker they need to use versus specific attacks. Combo Assist in this is less a crutch or a hand hold mechanic and more of a guide when it comes to using combos, it will automatically add in linkers to combos so that people who are unfamiliar with the game aren't left mashing buttons and making a fool of themselves because they don't know what they are doing, it will free flow the fight as best as it can to help guide people toward what they need to be doing, showing off what specials people could be doing to link the combo together and maximize the amount of damage they could possibly get, and due to the combo meter it stops people from being locked into combos forever since once a combo ends you are forced away, either by the opponent's combo ender or the combo forcing itself closed.

The price that they ask for on Steam you will get more out of the game than you could expect from something this priced. There are two story modes specific to the first two seasons of characters that came out, then with Season 3, which brought back the two original bosses from the franchise, Shadow Lords, a seperate scenario style campaign in which you pick the team that you wish to take in your attempt to overthrow the Shadow Lord himself. That's without taking into account the Shadow Lab mode which allows you to train a Shadow of yourself, an AI that learns and builds off your own patterns to fight in a similar manner to yourself, these Shadows are used within its own unique survival mode, as well as special missions that can crop up within the Shadow Lord mode.

If you're after a fighting game to get into, or you're looking to get a friend into fighting games, this is the best one that you could possibly start with, since it will not only teach the specific mechanics to this one, but also allow you to learn in time a lot of the mechanics that other competitive fighters share, though this one, eases you into it, so that it is a less daunting experience, as well as being much friendlier to new players.

If for some reason it doesn't work, I'll be sure to update my review accordingly. When Killer Instinct came to XBOX One, it was considered one exclusive too many by fans of the franchise.
When it came to Windows 10, people complained about the rampant microtransactions.

Now, it's so much better, for several reasons.
Firstly, It's on Steam, which has several benefits over XBOX Live for Windows.
Secondly, Any items which were outright 'paid content' are included.
Thirdly, some content that wasn't strictly meant to be free is included.

Now, I will admit, the 10th, special edition, colour is missing, and you lose out on the XBOX One's versions of KI1 and KI2, but what you do get is the full experience, complete with the Shadow opponents being sourced from BOTH XBOX Live and Steam players, meaning that moving to Steam doesn't mean you lose something from the two 'ghost' modes just because you're late to the party.

What you're not dealing with is the need to open your wallet every five minutes as the game reminds you to buy something to get the full experience. Instead, you've GOT the full experience, and at a fraction of the price.

35399972.review:
Quite possibly one of the most satisfying fighting game experiences. The game itself is just a fantastic plethora of fighting game quality and it was a must have for anyone that bought an Xbox One. However, now that it's out for PC it brings a breath of fresh air for this genre that has been lacking on the market and that is the fun factor. We have seen games such as Street Fighter 5 and Marvel vs. Capcom Infinite trying to cater to the professional audience in order to deliver a very balanced, or in some cases unbalanced, game that is very strict and unforgiving to the average consumer. However that's not what everyone wants, it's been stated that there's no point in playing a game that's not fun,

Killer Instinct has pulled the 180 that this market needs and that is to give a fighitng game experience that doesn't want you to smash your head through the Keyboard/Arcade stick/Controller. The gameplay is solid and fluid with every action. When you are able to string combos it's not a maticuluous and arguous process that can be punished, it's a fun easy to learn hard to master style. The Ultra combos are satisfying and rewarding when able to pull them off mid endgame fights, yet still feel deserved and not boring. 

There are some issues like the system being a bit confusing right off the start of the game, such as the set up. Honestly all you have to do is put the game in borderless mode to insure that the game goes fullscreen upon startup but fullscreen mode will reset if you set that as default. The game unfortunately does not support anything except mircosoft controllers and arcade sticks but this is easily fixed with JoystickToKey.

Overall it's an amazing experience that should be enjoyed for all fighting game lovers as a testiment of how fun these games should be. Ultra 10/10.

35393819.review:
A great fighting game.  An excellent replacement for NRS games if you don't have a current gen console and used to play MK/Inj a lot.

+ Nice mix of inputs for a variety of characters.  Characters also all have their own features or passives, making them all unique.
+ Combos have a low floor but high ceiling in regards to skill level to pull off the vast range of hits.  The simpler 8-15 hit ones that do 20ish% dmg are easy.  The huge insane ones not so much.
+ Great netcode.
+ Shadow Lords is such an amazing mode.  It's like base defense of XCOM w/ a team of characters you send out on missions.
+ They've added to the already great variety of aesthetic/flavor on the characters.  Old KI was cool w/ elemental beings, boxers, werewolves, cyborgs, dinosaurs, etc.  Now there are mummies, earth golems, vampires, Japanese horror girls, etc.
+ Good selection of ancillary modes - Shadow Lords, Shadow Labs, Survival, even a Combo Breaker Training. 
+ Tons of unlockables for costumes/profile banner.
+ Robust profile stat tracking.  Tracks stats in basically all modes for all characters, even their highest-count combo.
+ Even for a 4-year old niche game, the devs are still involved.  Game was patched just a month ago (they say possibly their last, but they're still active in the forums, social media, etc).
+ Some music is really good/catchy and the sfx are great.
+ CPU v CPU!

+- Can't control difficulty of Shadow Lords mode.  Unless you have Combo Assist on, training will be necessary for at least 3 characters.

- Story Mode and Shadow Lords story are a bit underwhelming (but there is a ton of backstory you can find online to make up for it, I guess).
- Combo Assist Mode can make you develop bad habits.
- Some unlockables come at a great price - monetarily or time-sink wise.

35384014.review:
This is the first Steam game I have ever refunded. 

I already knew microtransactions were in this game, and usually that means no purchase from me. However, I read that they were aesthetic items only, and all can be earned in game through normal gameplay, so I gave it a pass.

What I didn't know is that Iron Galaxy and M$ put an obxnious "store" entry on the main menu (which does NOT have an OPTIONS entry, btw, you need to find it in submenus) with a bouncing "!" icon next to it that you apparently cannot disable. This is flatly unacceptable and a non-starter. 

[update] According to someone who responded to my review, this annoying icon can be disabled by hitting "y" on the controller (and presumably a keyboard key) that I was not aware of. I tried clicking on the menu option to make it go away, it didn't. I'm still against it being there at all.

It also for some wierd reason defaulted to windowed mode while playing and set all graphical settings to minimal, even though I'm running a GTX 1070 (easily fixed, but annoying default behavior). In addition, the game delays letting you play while it syncronizes with their servers for "shadow lords" or something similar, which I can only presume is related to updating the aforementioned store content. It does this every single time you run the game and there doesn't appear to be a way to disable this behavior. 

In regards to the actual gameplay, it is much as I remember it from the 90's. An approachable and entertaining button masher. I only played a few matches against the AI, so I cannot give much insight into the mechanics. I did enjoy seeing Rash from Battletoads make an appearance.

For me to ever consider coming back to this game, Microsoft/Iron Galaxy would need to either A. remove all store/microtransaction nonsense from the game, entirely. Or B. keep the microtransaction nonsense and make this a free to play game, as they've obviously modeled it after. I don't expect they will be doing either, so this will likely be the only time I ever play KI for steam.

Very disappointed.

KI might be a decent game but I just don't like the combo breaker -system at all. In order to do a combo breaker you basically have to push buttons to match the type of combo your opponent is using. You only get one shot tho, since the combo breaker gets locked for a moment if/when you missclick.

On the other hand the combos are very easy to spam (for a beginner) but it's just silly how little damage the insane beating does if you don't do a certain 'finisher' move. This makes combos fairly one dimensional and I don't think you can play this game very well without learning to combo. No hit-here-and-there tactics.

I don't like the uninspired characters either, found maybe one that wasn't pain in the eye but decided to refund the game after all. There are just too many little and bigger things that hinder my experience with the game.

35365477.review:
XBox One版、Win10版プレイ済み

優秀すぎるコンボアシスト機能のおかげでどんな格ゲーよりも手軽に始めることができます

ストリートファイターのような厳しい目押しは必要なく、アーク系にある複雑なコンボの暗記/練習も要りません
猶予たっぷりの先行入力受付時間があり、通常技と必殺技を交互に入力するだけでバシバシコンボが決まります
またコンボアシストをオンにすると、前方向と攻撃ボタンの連打だけで一通りのコンボができます

そしてコンボブレイカーとそれにまつわるシステムがこのゲームを奥の深いものにしています

コンボを食らっている側は相手が繰り出す攻撃の威力、弱・中・強を瞬時に見極め、同じ威力のボタンを押すことで相手の繰り出すコンボを断ち切ることができます(C-C-C-COMBO BREAKER!!!)
グー・チョキ・パーをコロコロ変える人に合わせて後出しですぐにあいこをぶつける感じです
しかし、これであいこにならなかった場合は一定時間ブレイクの入力ができなくなりますし、攻撃してる側もブレイクが入力されるのを読んでさらなるカウンターをしかけることもできます
ほか、全キャラがゲージ1本で使えるガーキャン技:シャドーカウンターや、体力が少ない相手に一瞬で勝負をつける全自動死体蹴りコンボ:ウルトラといったシステム技も

全世界のプレイヤーのクセをまねた分身との対戦(熱帯の練習にどうぞ)やちょっとしたストーリー、侵略を進める悪役から地球を守るために戦う特殊なゲームモードなど遊び方も様々

アケコンではなくパッドでのプレイもしやすく、必殺技の入力は昇龍コマンド以上に難しいものはなくて右スティックでコンボブレイカーの入力もできます 世界大会などでもパッド使用者は多いです

各プラットフォーム別の違いですが、XBox版とWin10版は基本無料でキャラ単位/バンドルでの課金と両者間でのクロスバイ&クロスセーブが可能です Steam版は全キャラが含まれた他より安価な売り切りスタイルですが、クロスバイ&クロスセーブはできません またランクマッチのみSteam内で、それ以外のマルチプレイヤーは全プラットフォームで可能なクロスネットワークとなっています

35364520.review: Really fun, runs extremely well, great flow to the game/feels great.  If you enjoy fighting games this is a great buy.

35362856.review:
This quickly became one of my favorite fighting games of all time. And it has been only 2 days since I got the game!

This game has an amazing gameplay with possibly the best fighting/combo mechanics of all games, in my opinion. You don't have to spend weeks to learn a simple basic combo of a SINGLE character. You don't have to fight more to control your character and do their attacks, instead of focusing in the fun part: Fighting your oponent.

In this game it's really straightforward and simple to learn how to combo, but that doesn't mean the game is shallow. Not even close!

One of my favorite things in this game, is one of the Killer Instinct's signature: COMBO BREAKER. In other fighting games, when your oponent gets you in a combo string, all you can do is watch and wait as he juggles you around. Well, not in this game!

You have a chance to Combo Break his combo, and break free and fight back! And this is not an nearly impossible mechanic that requires weeks of training to get it right. It's as simple as pressing Kick+Punch in the same type your opponent is combo'ing you. (Ex: If he's using Heavy attacks, you press HP+HK, or Medium attacks you press MP+MK, etc.)

In this game there's always a way. There's always something you can do to fight back.

Not only that, all the characters are very nice, unique and they all act and feel different.

The sound effects, the announcer and the music are amazing! (The music was composed by none other than Mick Gordon. The same composer from Doom [2016])

Speaking of music, they are all dynamic, changing as the battle progress. Each character has it's own music theme, and they fit them really well.

The game has one of the best netcodes I've ever seen.

Amazing game modes, like the Shadow Labs, which the game will record the way you play and create an IA that plays like you, so you can fight agains yourself! (Or other IA created by other players).

Speaking of IA, the IA controlled opponents are very well done and challenging. It also has many difficulty levels.

This is a amazing game I can recommend for ANYONE, even those who are bad at fighting games (I'm one of those XD). It doesn't matter if you only want it for Singleplayer, or Multiplayer. You will have fun either way!

35362619.review:
Killer Instinct on the SNES was one of the first video games I ever played, so the series is special to me.

I never owned an Xbox One and Windows 10 is cancer, so this was my first chance to play this game, and wow, I just can't believe how much content there is in this game.

Single player: It's sad to me that in 2017 I am surprised to see fully fledged out single player modes in a fighting game, but here it is. You have Shadow Lords, two different story modes, Arcade, two different types of Survival mode, a fully featured tutorial mode that is arguably one of the best ones out there, and an extensive practice that even allows you to take some of the practice mode parameters and use it in the other 1p modes. I did a playthrough of arcade with all of the hitboxes turned on just for fun. 

For fans of Super Smash Bros 4, there is also a mode similar to how the Amiibos work, where you can train up a CPU character that has your fighting style and then it can earn you points towards unlocking skins, even when you're offline, when other players play through Shadow Survival mode. 

Multiplayer: Netcode is flawless, but be wary that the crossplay feature is only available for lobbies and exhibition, so if you want to play ranked it will be kind of dead or you'll be fighting the same guy over and over.

Gameplay system: Easy to learn, hard to master. My favorite type of game. You can start the game up and within a few matches you'll have most of the basic mechanics down. Very new player friendly.

Sound: The sound design in this game is amazing. Between the musical menus, the background music being truely dynamic and syncing up to the action (or lack thereof) in a match, and how guttural and viscious each attack sounds, I just can't praise it enough.

Summary: Amazing fighting game, especially as a fan of the series. One of the best ones on the market right now. My only gripes are the fact that there's no f2p model so there won't get to be as many people to try it out, and the lack of the original 2 Killer Instincts that's on the XB1 version.

The core game is great, has all the modern mechanics that make a fighting game be relevant today. I am completely new to the franchise but I love that there are characters from many differnet games in this one game, such as General RAAM from Gears of War, and the Arbiter from Halo.

Most importantly the game is challenging while retaining lots of fun and content.

35354913.review:
Отличный файтинг с прекрасным звуковым сопровождением, качественным неткодом и, самое главное,
интересной боевой системой.
Брать, играть, огребать, побеждать!

Визуальная составляющая не вызывает никаких вопросов - разрушающийся задний план,
куча эффектов от суперспособностей персонажей, плавно-перетекающие друг из друга 
анимации ударов позволяют наслаждаться введенными комбинациями и чувствовать себя
познавшим дзен человеком. Плюс ко всему, все это дело оптимизировано на отлично и
даже изменяя разрешение экрана потеря в визуальной составляющией игры минимальна,
особенно если играть на диване с геймпадом, например.

Звук - отдельный, выгодно выделяющий эту игру на фоне остальных представителей данного жанра, аспект. Да, в том же MKX нашему слуху тоже предлагают насладиться тем, 
как хрустят кости, рвутся конечности и вытекают все жидкости из соперника, но здесь это
выведено на новый уровень засчет чуть ли не идеального качества исполнения (могу звучать немного субъективно, но поверьте, даже если преувеличиваю, то совсем немного).
Каждый удар идеально озвучен и это помогает, наряду с визуалом, еще и с помощью аудиальной составляющей еще больше окунуться в происходящее, и, как было сказано выше, познать инь-янь (поверьте, понятия восточной мудрости вам пригодятся далее, ибо иначе вы, после очередного проигрыша или отданного камбека разнесете либо монитор, либо геймпад, либо монитор геймпадом).

А теперь самый главный аспект, сам боевой процесс - Killer Instinct предлагает необыную систему сражений, и если описывать ее вкратце, то получится нечто вроде супер-удар - обычный удар - снова супер-удар - снова обычный удар - ТЕНЕВОЙ супер-удар и так до бесконечности. Звучит легко и скучно, не правда ли? Но на деле оказывается, что начинать ввод комбинаций можно разными путями и если этого не делать, ваши атаки опытный игрок начнет считывать и за это вы будете огребать по самые небалуй, что поможет Вашему инстинкту убийцы проснуться и либо сожрать с потрохами своего оппонента, либо показать любому подручному предмету в квартире, кто здесь настоящий прирожденный борец (с собственной яростью, в данном случае). В случае удачного применения ваш один введенный удар персонаж реализует за два, что за собой влечет какое-то буйство ударов и супер-приемов, а если еще и подрубить систему помощи ввода комбинаций, то просто прокатываясь лицом по Вашему файтстику/геймпаду/клавиатуре Вы снова станете ближе к тому, чтобы черное и белое слилось в одно целое и Ваше седьмое чувство пробудилось (серьезно, играя в Killer Instinct, даже будучи новичков, прогресс ощущается очень хорошо и день ото дня вы будете чувствовать, насколько плодотворно вчера раздавали тумаков или огребали оных). 
Сюда же можно добавить ОТЛИЧНУЮ систему обучения, которая позволит не только познать то, как начать играть именно в Killer Instinct, но и в целом расскажет Вам много важных аспектов самого жанра fighting в целом.

Никогда не играл в игры данной франшизы  в жизни, но на слуху вертелось это сочетение слов. Увидел в стиме, купил, попробовал.. И пропал. Затягивает на отлично.

Брать Вам Killer Instinct или нет - решайте сами, но скажу вот чего - 
Боевая жаба, анонсер, рвущий глотку при каждой успешно-примененной комбинации ударов, очень интенсивные и быстрые схватки в сети делают эту игру одной из моих любимых представителей жанра.

Keep calm and keep on fighting!
